review.reviewBody: i don't get it why the upf rating 10. Should it not be at least 30?
It's comfortable to wear as a baselayer in hot or cold climates and provides great sun protection.
review.name: Great baselayer for sunny days

review.reviewBody: Great hoodie for just about anything. Keeps the wind out dries quickly and is breathable.
review.name: Great hoodie

review.reviewBody: Nothing even comes close to the Echo Hoodie. I've tried others, tried to save money but ended up wasting it. In how they feel, keep up with your activity and still outlast you. I still have my original grey one that I work in my engine room with. It's beat but still keep delivering. I even wear them when SCUBA diving and swimming. I literally live in these things. I'll take another!
review.name: Don't buy another sun hoodie

review.reviewBody: Received the Echo hoodie a few weeks ago. Great everyday casual wear, as well works well for workouts. We haven't had much sun, so haven't checked it out as sun pro yet. Would buy another if my size/colour was in stock.
review.name: GREAT ALL AROUND HOODIE

review.reviewBody: Great look, great fit, great protection, happy with purchase. 5'8" 195 lbs purchased XL, true to size.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: I own 6 of these and wear one any time I'm out in the sun all day. Pefect alternative to sunscreen. They breath in hot weather and wick moisture. I didn't appreciate how well these keep me comfortable in hot weather until I wore a regular tshirt or even other 'performance' clothing, then went back to the echo. Among my favorite OR pieces.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: Love these extreme light weight sun protective shirts. Great for the hottest of days. My favorite shirts to wear.
review.name: The best shirts ever for the sun.

review.reviewBody: Gear is light and very confortable, I recommend this product first every day usage.
review.name: Confortable and practical

review.reviewBody: It's a miracle shirt. As a casual hiker/backpacker and tourist I've worn for sun protection, snorkeling, hot jungles, light rain and even in cooler weather. It dries faster than any shirt I've ever had, stays relatively cool in hot humid jungles, protects you from sun and keeps some warmth in cooler weather. Worn for many days on occasion and doesn't stink much from Aruba, Mexico, Florida to the Smokies. I have seven now and will buy more. DO NOT CHANGE A THING PLEASE!!!
review.name: Miracle shirt

review.reviewBody: Bottom line: amazing backpack. Suits my day by day strolls in the city, for work, weekends. Besides, it has a great design. The size is ideal (20L). Couldn't ask for more.
review.name: Couldn't ask for more.

review.reviewBody:
This is currently my favorite bag. I've had it for four or five years and its versatility never ceases to amaze me. It is my only bag on a one-week trip to warm climate, fitting 7 days of men's clothes, toiletries, plus laptop. It was a last-minute trip, so just wanted something I could fit under the seat on an airplane. Stowing the straps makes that so much easier than with other bags. You have to pack pretty minimally and I ditched the packing cubes to make everything fit, but it's working great so far. No room for water bottle, so I just bought one at the airport and carried it in my hand. 

I've taken this on a few, long, strenuous day hikes, and when you cinch down the backpack straps tightly, it remains very comfortable, even with heavy water bottles in tow. Really amazing considering how little padding there is when compared to all the overbuilt bags coming out these days.  

Originally purchased for work and it excels at that too. Stands up very nicely when full--but if only partially filled and the top pocket is crammed with stuff, then it won't stand too well, unless you have a laptop in it. 

My wife always compliments the bag all the time when she sees it on my back--says that it's just somehow aesthetically pleasing. I love the shape and the material--very nice to the touch and to the eyes, and also hardwearing and eco-friendly. 

Obviously more organization would be helpful, but then you'd lose the beautiful simplicity. I find the top pocket is just enough for my trinkets and things--keeps me from overpacking. 

If Fjallraven made one in 23 or 25 liters, I'd buy one in a heartbeat. 

It has gone up about $6 in price since I bought it several years ago.
review.name: Less Is More Was Never Truer

review.reviewBody:
I love this backpack. Perfect size. Use it all the time,everywhere. I've been using it for over a year and it has performed great throughout all the seasons, specially well in rain and snowy days. 
Only thing I would like to add is a bit longer straps or extensions to them. I find if the bag is really full it feels too tight specially when wearing a winter coat. Other than that, amazing bag!!!
This is a really nice lightweight bag.  But it needs more zipper pockets.  It only has two.  One large zipper compartment on the outside and one small zipper pocket on the inside.
review.name: Needs more zipper pockets.

review.reviewBody: One of my favorite bags! I love the simplicity of the design and itâs very comfortable and versatile. I use it for city errands, work commutes, beach days, and overnights. Itâs durable and the red color looks so nice. One suggestion: I would love to see a version of this bag with a separated bottom compartment, accessible with a lower zipper that unzips all around to store shoes or wet/dirty gear. That would be the perfect gym/beach/overnight bag!
review.name: Perfect! Plus one suggestion.

review.reviewBody: Pretty much the perfect bag for me. I liked the first one I bought so much I bought another one within a week or two to use as a gym bag. It holds "just enough" stuff to be useful without the hassle of checking multiple pockets/sections of a traditional backpack. the handles are perfect - the right thickness and size for carrying it easily. The backpack straps are fine and comfy. Colors I bought (light grey and olive green) are classy. I'm tempted to buy a few more to give as gifts.
review.name: The perfect bag

review.reviewBody: I bought this for traveling as I needed a bag that coul work around whatever luggage I need for different trips and something that could also be used as a day pack for city or rural adventures. I have found that I now use it in crossbody form almost daily. My one major complaint is that the backpack form would be so much more comfortable with a chest strap, especially for day hikes. Also if the backpack straps could be just a bit longer for larger people. But both of these edits would make the pack a bit less streamlined. A Velcro pad for the crossbody strap would also be an amazing addition. Overall, a much more functional transition pack than any other backpack/tote combo I can find as it's the only one with a good crossbody option.
review.name: Very versatile

review.reviewBody:
I was looking for a backpack for daily and travel use, that can also change to a crossbody bag for visiting museums and other places where backpacks aren't allowed. 

This bag is great! It's comfortable as a backpack, I think it looks stylish, and it would be fine for dayhikes as well as walking around in a city. It easily holds a water bottle and umbrella, sketchbook and pens, jacket, and anything else I need in a day. I also love that it's not super structured, so when it's not bulky when there are few things in it. When wearing it as a backpack, it's easy to swing it around to get into the pockets without taking it completely off.

The only thing that keeps it from being 5 stars is that the clasps on the crossbody strap are hard to use. You have to squeeze the hard plastic while pushing the spring-loaded metal part and it's hard to get a grip on it because of the way it's attached to the strap. This means changing back and forth between crossbody and backpack is a little inconvenient and was kind of hard to do while standing in line at a museum. 

If you're taking suggestions, an easier to use strap attachment and a second internal pocket that could fit a passport would make it perfect. It's still better than any other backpack or convertible bag I've tried though.
review.name: Almost perfect for travel and daily use!

review.reviewBody: I bought this totepack for daily use at school. I was a little sceptical of the size but thus far it has proven to be perfect. The bottom is strong and reinforced so it won't break, the straps are surprisingly comfortable and the size is just right so you don't carry more than you need. The extra small pocket is in the ideal place for grabbing your stuff and it sits really well (backpacks that tip over are TERRIBLE). I got it in the fog grey, and it has a slight sage green tinge which is really nice. Perfect for daily use.
review.name: Awesome for school

review.reviewBody: I use this tote/pack daily for bringing items to work and for running errands.  Itâs the perfect size for essentials with extra room for when you purchase something and need a bag for it.  It really shined on a recent trip to Greece and Italy.  It easily packed in my suitcase and became my daily bag for walking around - I much prefer it to bags that pack in their own pocket because I donât feel they offer enough support.  I have it in the mustard color and love it!!  I would highly recommend.
review.name: Awesome for daily use and travel!

name: Vardag Totepack

review.itemreviewed: TX2 Evo Leather Approach Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Sizing is different than TX2 Evo, and fits me better.  Sizing similar to TX4.  The leather version is not packable like the non-leather version.  They take up about as much room as TX4s.  Unlike the TX2 non-leather version, the tongue is not gusseted which is a plus for me.
review.name: TX2 Evo Leather

review.itemreviewed: TX2 Evo Leather Approach Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I love La Sportiva approach shoes, this is my third pair.  I wish La Sportiva would keep styles around a little longer.  Each pair have been completely different.  
These are very comfortable and appear to be high quality.  They caught my eye because it was stated they are resoleable, which means I'll be able to keep them longer.
BEWARE of the sizing, they are not correct.  I wear 10 - 10.5, the reviews state they are small, so I purchased 10.5 (43.5), way too small.  I went to 10.5+ (44), still too small, and finally 11 (44.5) and received a reasonable fit.  By too small, I mean my toes hit the end of the shoe.
review.name: Comfortable w/ strong Grip,but bad size

review.itemreviewed: TX2 Evo Leather Approach Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are great approach shoesâ¦while they last. Unfortunately Iâve now had 3 different pairs of these (covered under warranty thankfully) and every single pair started developing a major separation/tear between the leather and rubber at the front outside edge in the exact same spot after just 2 months or less of normal occasional use. I had a previous pair of the past TX2 leathers that lasted 3 years and a resole and they never tore at all. Please fix this major durability issue!
review.name: Major Durability Issues

review.itemreviewed: TX2 Evo Leather Approach Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have been a long-time fan of La Sportiva and the new TX2 EVO Leather does not disappoint.   Fit is wider in the toebox area compared to the TX Guide,  but narrower in the toe box compared to the TX3.  I have a roughly D width forefoot and the fit is perfect.  I debated going up a half size, but stayed with my true measured size.  For a real approach shoe, I want them to be snug for performance when scrambling.   The EVA midsole provides enough cushion but is also very low profile and feels natural for scrambling.   The shoes are low bulk and could be clipped to the harness (heel has an elastic cord to put them together to be compact).  The sole tread is burly and sticky.  The lugs are pretty low profile and perform well on both dirt and rock.  The upper leather so far feels pretty tough.  Heel and toe rubber protectors are minimal, yet critical for durability.  Typically when the tread on my approach shoes is worn out, the uppers are also in dire condition.  The EVO has an option to be easily resoled and these uppers seem durable enough to have multiple soles.    Well done La Sportiva!  I highly recommend giving these a try.
review.name: Excellent approach shoes!

review.itemreviewed: TX2 Evo Leather Approach Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I've been wearing this shoe for a few weeks now and thus far am very impressed. Overall it performs similarly to the tx3 or tx4, but is significantly lighter and more packable. This is a perfect shoe for multipitch climbing with a walk off that you'd want approach shoes for. The bungee cord system to attach the shoes together is intuitive and simple. They also scramble really well compared to other approach shoes that I've used- so far I've only done some 4th class climbing in them, but they feel very comfortable in that kind of terrain. 

As for fit, I sized them the same as the tx3/4 and I find them to be a little tight in the toe box, which is my only real criticism of them at this point. with that in mind, I'd recommend going up a half size to accommodate. 

For me this is my new go to shoe for in a day missions in the mountains or long walks to my local crag.
review.name: Awesome lightweight approach shoe

name: TX2 Evo Leather Approach Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the Sea To Summit Comfort Blend Sleeping Bag Liner online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Comfort Blend Sleeping Bag Liner
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Comfort Blend Sleeping Bag Liner online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag liner is perfect! I had the original cotton one that has lasted me a lifetime and this is the upgrade. So soft, easy to move around in and not feel claustrophobic. Would 200% recommend!
review.name: Love love love!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this new Comfort Blend Sleeping Bag Liner. I have two other sleeping bag liners from Sea to Summit. The Reactor Extreme and the Cool Max Liner. I prefer the Comfort Blend to both of these and use it the most often. I have used the liner about fifty days this summer and have found it to be versatile across a wide range of conditions and temperatures. It is also holding up very well. I hope to get several seasons of heavy use out of this liner. My favorite design feature of this liner is the shape compared to the others mentioned. It has plenty of room and I never feel cramped. It is the perfect accompaniment to the Ascent Down Sleeping Bag. Thank you Sea to Summit for another great piece of camp gear.
review.name: Best Liner Yet!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect for keeping my quilt clean and mosquitoes off my skin. It's soft, quiet, and doesnt hold condensation like the cheaper synthetic liners. It's lightweight and doesn't take up a lot of room in the pack.
review.name: Perfect for Bikepacking

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This product was a perfect fit for my sleeping bag and kept me warm at night in the early camping season. The material is soft, comfortable and light weight. It fits all aspects of my sleeping experience. When I sleep, I toss from side to side and the liner gets wrapped up in my legs for a moment then I adjust. It would be nice to have the end snapped into place to get rid of the leg entanglement.
review.name: Cozy and toasty

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I needed a sleep sack for a few days of hiking hut to hut in Norway. After a lot of shopping around, I landed on this one, and it did not disappoint. Super comfy, breathable, lightweight, small pack-down size. Loved the pillow pocket as well. I'm really happy with this purchase and can't wait to use it again!
review.name: Great for hut to hut hiking!

review.reviewBody: I used this while bikepacking on the Great Allegheny Passage a couple weeks ago. It was great used in conjunction with a lighter weight quilt.
review.name: Great for bikepacking

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This liner is thin but oh so soft. It feels like a gentle sheet. This is super easy to store inside your sleeping bag while itâs rolled up and very portable. This makes for a great sleep on warmer nights when you just need a little something extra for comfort in your bag. It also has a handy pillow sleeve.
review.name: Super soft liner made for comfort and ease

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Sea to Summit Comfort Blend Sleeping Bag Liner is a game-changer for outdoor enthusiasts! Its stretch-knit fabric, crafted from polyester and TENCEL Lyocell fibers, creates a cozy, moisture-wicking layer that enhances sleep quality. Plus, the rectangular design with a pillow sleeve ensures maximum comfort and convenience. Super comfortable, easy to pack and it looks like its long lasting! It's like bringing the comfort of your bed to the great outdoors! Not only does it keep your sleeping bag clean, but it also improves your sleep climate for a restful night under the stars. Say goodbye to rough nights and hello to camping bliss with this incredible liner!
review.name: Super cute!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bad liner is awesome! It keeps the heat in and makes keeping my sleeping bag clean! I just toss it on the washer when weâre done! It makes things so much easier! Plus itâs soft!
review.name: Soft and easy to clean

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This may be great for keeping your bag cleaner but it is only a little tighter weave than mosquito netting and you can see through it easily... I will be returning it as I was hoping for a little more warmth.
review.name: Okay

name: Comfort Blend Sleeping Bag Liner

review.reviewBody: Biggest issue is they fall down unless you tie the string very tightly which is not very comfy. Even then the crotch threatens to lower when taking big steps. They also tore on the first day i wore them, right at the pocket seam so be careful when pulling them up! I am not sure they are meant for more curvy folk, as a large was too big on me, but the medium is a bit tight on thighs and loose on my waist, though the length is great (5'8, 160lb). I do like that they go from trail to casual wear.
review.name: Ok, not great for the cost tbh

review.reviewBody: Really pleased with my purchase. Fit is perfect and really comfortable.
review.name: Abisko Tights

review.reviewBody:
Hike , run , great fit ! Happy with them .  
I am usually wear a medium but with this model maybe Large .
review.name: I love my tights!

review.reviewBody: These are great hiking and every day tights! Based on another review, I thought they'd be softer. But make no mistake, these are technical feeling tights...like running tight material. Definitely not a bad thing, just not what I was expecting. Regardless, they're amazing tights and fit like a glove.
review.name: Love!

review.reviewBody: Buttery soft and super breathable essential tights for summer.  These are my go to for everyday life.  Light enough for the hottest summer days, but with a fine stretchy weave and just enough structure that you donât feel over exposed.  Hands down the most comfortable stretchy pants in the lineup!
review.name: Perfect Summer Tights

review.reviewBody: I bought these in black and quickly returned them. They are not nearly as nice as the trail tights. They are not flattering, start to sag easily and don't have a zippered pocket. They are disappointing compared to the older versions of leggings from this company.
review.name: NOT AS NICE AS TRAIL TIGHTS

review.reviewBody: Very light and comfortable chair. I took it out on a backpacking trip and one leg broke on the first trip. Iâm about 210 lbs. Might be better for lighter guys. Good news though. Backcountry is replacing without issue. This is why I buy 90% of my gear from them. Great prices and great customer service. I will be a little more gentle on the replacement and hope for the best. I will say that there is a missed opportunity from Helinox though. The part that broken was a bottom leg and could have been easily replaced. But their website doesnât have pipe parts only the seat material. I would have paid a few bucks to just keep the chair and replace the leg if that was an option. I give it 4 stars though overall.
review.name: High back Chair

review.reviewBody: I did a side by side seat test on this chair, the Nemo Moonlight, Nemo Moonlight Elite and Big Agnes UL Skyline. They are all great chairs but the reasons I chose this was because I could slide down a little and my head could rest on the back, so I could actually take a snooze in this chair.....something you can't do with ANY of the other chairs. I'm 5'9", 180 so may not work for a taller, bigger person. The other reason is because this chair only weighs in a few ounces more than the Moonlight Elite. It's a LIGHT chair. AND the Helinox Ground sheet can also double as a bag for the chair since it has a strap on it. That will only add another 2oz over the original bag.
review.name: Picked this out of 4 chairs

review.reviewBody:
Received my high back chairs, they were fully packaged,  yet when I opened them  cover on one of the chairs had dirt stains on the cover?
Why would you package knowing the cover for the $170 chair had stains on multiple spots?
Help
review.name: Disappointed

name: Chair Zero High Back

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased a 25L Dry Creek Bag and did so because two of my friends have the same bag.  Their bags came with pockets on either end of the bag for extra storage.  The bag I just purchased has the mounting brackets for the pockets but didn't come with the pockets.  Simms corporate just told me that they no longer make the additional pockets even thou the bag has mounting brackets for pockets.  One of the reasons I purchased the bag was for the extra pockets.  Consequently, I'm returning the bag.
review.name: bob s in spokane wa

review.reviewBody: Highly recommended if you're looking for a boat bag and comparing this to other similar ones on the market. The overhang creates a drip edge that sheds water away even when it isn't zipped up, and the magnetic closure is a really nice touch. They also put a bomber coating and some feet on the bottom (big improvement from the old model) so it can slide around on the floor of the boat and not wear through and leak from the bottom. I'd love it to be a touch bigger like the old style was, but this is still a great size to gold all your gear.
review.name: Tough, sheds water, best you'll find

review.reviewBody: Itâs a great bag , I could use one a bit bigger to be honest. Wish the zippers were a bit beefier. But thatâs been a problem with every boat bag Iâve owned. Simms makes great products!
I got many years of service out of my old one. This one is built to last even longer. Very thoughtful improvements!
Great way for a guide to organize all of your gear.
review.name: Perfect size and well built

review.reviewBody: The zipper on the lid was better on the old style. These zipper are hard to get stuff in and out of
Perfect thus far, see how it does in AK and here in MT over next 5 months!
review.name: Perfect so far!

review.reviewBody: The Dry Creek Boat bag is a winner. I use it in my drift boat. The magnetic latch is genius. Easy access to flies, etc. inside. Wrap around zippers provide secure closure when I am carrying it from my rig to my drift boat. If Iâm changing patterns, I can stick the bugs to the Velcro patches on top of the bag. Allows me to see whatâs working and what isnât. The fabric is bullet proof.
review.name: Bullet Proof

review.reviewBody:
Quality workmanship and materials. 
I bought the 25L to carry all the fishing gear I need to guide day long trips in Alaska.
review.name: Exactly what I needed

review.reviewBody: This pack is compact and light, holds a variety of things, of all shapes and sizes, and the best part...its waterproof! Definately would recommend to others!
review.name: Perfect

name: Dry Creek Boat Bag - Large

review.reviewBody: It's been good on the two hikes I've been on.  I wish there was a place to hold a small water bottle on the belt pouch, but other than that, I love it!
review.name: Comfy backcountry pack

review.reviewBody:
Well thought out with the clever opening for when you get to the lodge, lay your bag on the table and have access to everything. Camelback water integration is perfect.
The fleece lined goggle pocket is good to prevent scratches but not sure why the key holder is there. Easy front pocket with red zipper for stashing snacks, money and other small things. My ski partner can easily grab out a snack on the chairlift.

But what makes this bag standout is it's backcountry flexibility. Holds a snowboard or skis for us to be able to ride a snowmobile to the top and go back down. A buddy system to hit the best snow.

The size is bigger with a comfy waist belt (stash the keys in those pockets!) I can carry and extra layer for myself, my son and lunch for the family.
review.name: Great Winter Backpack

name: Ride 24L Backpack

review.reviewBody: They are NOT waterproof.  I live in the mountains and wear those boots in the garden. During a rain - I walked through puddles.  My feet were Not dry. and were cold. I was upset as How can a deck shoe not be waterproof?  I wish I had known sooner so I could have returned them. I've had them for about 4 months. I'm disappointed with the quality and misleading advertisement.
review.name: Wait, do not  purchase - Not Waterproof
comment:
Hello,
We do offer a one year limited warranty on our boots.  Please reach out to our customer care team so we can make sure you are 100% satisfied with your purchase. xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com

review.reviewBody: Love these boots! So easy to step into and wear all day!
review.name: Need them in every color!

review.reviewBody: Great boots, they do run big. I wish I would have known that. Even with thick socks they're a little big.
review.name: Good boots

review.reviewBody: I bought them 3 months ago  and they wear so good and the widths it perfect
review.name: great futures

review.reviewBody: This is my 5th pair all the same model/type, 4 blue ones and I light green. Two of my blue one's cracked with 1 in ch openings within months of wearing them which is super disappointing for the price. I did do an email for a new pair or a credit or something but received nothing which was very disappointing. I don't work in saltwater or chlorine these are mostly for dog walking and yard work on slick surfaces and that is the only reason I repurchased was due to the tread, the grip. I'm hoping this pair does not start falling apart soon after I open the box and start wearing them. The only other reason I repurchased is because I've been caring for my mother and I haven't had a chance to go try brands on. I was so disappointed with not getting a credit for another pair of the ones that we're only months old yet have 1 in cracks and multiple places and then my socks get wet and then my feet get wet. I love the style I love the look I love the height. Have worn them with jeans and a nice top because I love the look. I own hiking shoes that have been to many states and walked thousands of miles and they still haven't fallen apart which is what I expect for the price I paid which is similar to my purchase with you. That's my honest review. How about I get that credit so I can get another pair. Thank you
review.name: This is my fifth pair.

review.reviewBody: Traveled in these comfy good looking boots to rainy cities. They were comfy, cute and practical.
review.name: Great boots for rainy weather

review.reviewBody: Great boots when youâre out on the water but donât need intense ppe.
review.name: Perfect for long days on the water.

review.reviewBody: These ankle boots are exactly what I was looking for! They are easy to slip into, petfect for yard work in any weather, wet or dry.
review.name: Versatile and Fashionable Ankle Boots

review.reviewBody: These boots are comfortable enough to wear all day without making my feet sore, and obviously they keep me dry! They aren't too insulating, which is good for me because I don't want hot sweaty feet all day on the boat. My one qualm is that I wish they were a little more slip resistant. Iâm usually a 9.5 in shoes but the 9s fit me perfectly so I would suggest sizing down if your in between sizes.
review.name: Great boots for out at sea

review.reviewBody: I have only been wearing these boots for not even 7 months and they have already started to show wear and cracking in the toe area (see photos). I store them inside and dry when I am not wearing them. I am very disappointed that I have gotten less than a years wear out of brand new boots. I had almost convinced my coworkers to purchase them, until they started wearing.
review.name: I was raving about these boots untilâ¦

review.reviewBody: Its faulty - one blue light blinking and doesnt take a charge.
review.name: Blinking blue light

review.reviewBody: The charging design cannot reallly fit into an outlet.   Horrible charging design.  Next there is only USB and no C.  So, why are they selling this in 2025?  It is outdated.
review.name: breakable charging design

review.reviewBody: Absolutely terrible charging design. Forget even trying to plug this thing directly to an AC adaptor. Get a USB extender, and find something that is just the right elevation so that the Flipout is exactly horizontal with the extender attached to the ac adaptor. that is the only way this thing will charge. If you even bump it slightly, it will stop charging. I wish i could just return this thing but i got it as a gift, so i just have to make it work.
review.name: Terrible charging design

review.reviewBody: My first one lasted for about 4 trips until the charging USB broke off. Just bought a second one and now on my second time out the blue light blinks but it wonât charge. The owners manual is of no use.
review.name: Do not buy this product

review.reviewBody: Iâve had the Goal Zero Flip 36 Recharger for a few years, now. I take this charger both on international/domestic travels as well as camping and backpacking trips. This charger is extremely reliant and efficient. I can charge my >10% iPhone battery and an Apple Watch with plenty of spare charge left. Really great for a multi day trip. Love the ease of charging the machine itself as well.
review.name: Durable and Long Lasting

review.reviewBody:
The Goal Zero Flip 36 is the worst electronic product I have purchased, but I guess you get what you pay for?

I am just disappointed because it never worked the way you advertised. I took great care of it and it just stopped working within 6 months of use. It never seemed to recharge my iPhone âup to 3 timesâ lucky if I got 1 full charge and now the unit itself wonât even recharge. Not to mention, the fold-out usb port is a terrible design - very weak and just waiting to break. 

Now that Iâm looking for a more heavy duty portable charger, how could I even entertain Goal Zero after such an experience with their entry level product never performing to how itâs advertised?  Did I get a defective unit?
review.name: Flip 36 - donât trust the advertisement

review.reviewBody: These are great. I loaded up with several and the little docking port. They are powered up and ready to go all the time.
review.name: Perfect power pack!

hasVariant.description: Buy the Salomon ADV Skin 12L Hydration Vest Set online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: As it's bought as a Christmas Gift, I cannot make any comment at the time of writing
review.name: bought as gift

review.reviewBody: Sizing chart is spot on. I am a smaller woman, 5'5" ish and about 120pounds but I prefer the unisex bags for their sizing and set up with the pockets in front being bigger and not slanted, like the women specific vests. I prefer to use large bladders and a 1.5L bladder fits perfect, feels comfortable, and has a sleeve for it, as well as a clip type system on the top to hold the bladder in place. I love the colour. Been using it LOTS over many months and it still looks brand new. Great quality, no complaints.
review.name: Great pack, great fit, super comfy. Love it!

review.reviewBody: This has been really carefully designed is definitely worth the price tag.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: This is my second Salomon vest (upgraded from Adv skin 8 to a 12 for more space), and this vest is so versatile. Can take it for all day hikes or long trail runs. Bring it on shorter runs too where I just want to carry water and you don't notice the bulk of the bag. Feels seamless and easy to forget its on your back.
review.name: Always trust in Salomon

review.reviewBody: I bought this vest a couple of months ago and have loved having it with me on my long runs! I love how much storage there is for all of my fuel and the water flasks are the perfect size. I am 5â 3â and about 175# and the medium fit great for me.
review.name: Great Purchase!

review.reviewBody: I bought one of these packs from another website and within a few months, the stitching had come apart on one of the pockets rendering it useless. Other than that the pack is amazing and super comfortable. Just a shame I can't use one of the zip pockets now because of poor construction.
review.name: Great Pack - Terrible Durability
comment:
Hello Joe! 
We apologize in advance for any inconvenience caused. We appreciate you taking the time on sharing your pictures. 
A member of our team will contact you shortly to discuss your experience.

review.reviewBody: My first ever running vest bought on good reviews here and elsewhere. So far I'm really pleased with its quality, lightweight, design, usefulness and practically. I use it for just about everything - running, hiking, travelling, holidays (including the beach!).
review.name: All round brilliant vest!

review.reviewBody: Bought one for myself and one for my husband! Absolutely love it! Doesnât move at all when running and extremely comfy with plenty of accessible pockets
review.name: What an awesome bit of kit

review.reviewBody: I've had my ADV Skin 12 for about 4 years now. I've used it on training runs all the way up to a 240 mile trail run. It's very comfortable and easy to put on and take off. It isn't the most durable for crawling through branches and thickets, but that really isn't the purpose of this bag. After 4 years of use, it is time to think about replacing it. I have had to replace the front attachment straps, but that only happened a couple months ago. So they are pretty durable even though they are very thin.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: I bought this two months ago and absolutely love it. Everything I hoped it would be!
review.name: Great vest!

name: ADV Skin 12L Hydration Vest Set

review.reviewBody:
I purchased the handlebar bag and returned it after seeing it in person. I think it's a shame that there are no pictures of what the bag looks like when it's open and you're trying to put stuff in it. 
The bag is good for what it is but it's not what most people will want for a handlebar bag. It's difficult to get things in and out of the bag. You'll probably have to assume that you'll repack everything every time you go into it. 

This *is not* a well-designed day bag that you'd want for a long ride to hold food and a layer. This is good for the narrow scenario when you want a small waterproof bag that you'll access rarely but still happy losing a fair amount of grip space on your handlebars.

It's also pricy relative to other bags which have more utility.
review.name: Bought and returned

name: BOA Handlebar Pack

hasVariant.description: Buy the La Sportiva Cobra Eco Climbing Shoe online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Wow, the Cobra is a longstanding classic slipper.  The OG, the GOAT, and I like the Eco concept, but they do not use Vibram Grip this version of the shoe.  The Frixtion rubber they use on this one is harder and far less sticky and malleable.  A slipper is soft and malleable shoe...and pairing this hard/generic rubber on this shoe destroys its performance.  Please go back to Vibram XS Grip or Grip2.  This is terrible shoe as is.
review.name: Awesome shoe ruined by the terrible new rubber.

review.reviewBody: This shoe is the longstanding classic shape of the Cobra. The Cobra has been my favorite shoe for many years for the gym and sandstone.  It's flexibility and sensitivity is unparalleled.   The fit of the Eco is the same, but Eco Frixion rubber is not the same as XS Grip.  It is notably less sticky largely because it is considerably stiffer than XS Grip which is a huge detractor to the overall performance of this soft, supple and sensitive shoe.  Eco Frixion may even be harder than XS Edge which Sportiva uses on its stiff edging shoes.  In any case, for me, I won't be buying the Eco anymore.  I will seek out the original cobra with XS Grip.  Putting hard rubber on this soft and sensitive shoe was a bad design decision.  I am so bummed I bought these Eco's.
review.name: The Awesome Cobra shape but rubber-ugh

review.reviewBody:
I bought the Cobra as an all around shoe and primarily climb granite. I've been using them for long trad, bouldering, sport and the gym. I really wanted a slipper so I didn't have to tie my shoes so often. The shoe is not down turned and comes out of the box with a flat last. It is a very soft shoe.

Sizing the shoe was tough because they are not available in my area. I got them in 41 and went up a half size from my TC Pros (40.5) and down a half size from the TX4 approach shoes (41.5). They fit great, the heel is snug and I can wear them for extended times.
review.name: A comfy and precise shoe

review.reviewBody: Overall, really a good shoe. Though I donât think I would classify it as aggressive, it makes up for it in comfort and letâs be honest, there is not really such a thing as a comfortable and aggressive shoe. The only issue I have is that the heel wonât be having a vacuum fit which I predicted before buying due to the shoe not having any straps and seeing how the rand is situated, itâs really not that big of a problem though.the heel still allows for relatively solid heel hooking. My favorite aspect, aside from the comfort, is the tie and the rubber. The rubber is by far the stickiest I have had out of the half-dozen shoes I have been through. And the toe is precise and pointy and fits perfectly in pockets as well as being sensitive enough to allow effective smearing. I highly recommend these shoes for the gym or a long day out where performance and comfort are equally important. They do stretch a bit, I sized down 2 sizes and in about 2 weeks they were perfect.
review.name: Great All-Around Slipper

review.reviewBody: Exactly the same as the original Cobra. Perfectly soft and comfortable. I use this shoe mainly for speed climbing and training indoors, and it hasn't let me down yet. Highly recommend!
review.name: Great training shoe

review.reviewBody: Sublimely comfortable while not compromising performance. Like itâs predecessor, the Eco Cobra delivers all-day, all-around aggressive performance under any circumstance â from long multi-pitch granite routes to slick sandstone slopers to steep indoor gym climbing â and everything in-between. I greatly appreciate the use of non-toxic biodegradable leather and recycled materials. I will never leave home without these legendary shoes. â¤ï¸
review.name: The Legend Reborn

review.reviewBody:
First time I wore them was in a comp. Performed amazingly. Not the best for strenuous heel hooks, but I donât know of any slip on thatâs great for that. Performed surprisingly well on thin slab. Definitely recommend (two buddies that I climbed with already said they were going to buy them after seeing how well mine performed, so thereâs that)

Be warned, they run a little large. I wear an 11 US tennis shoe. I wear a 9.5 (42.5) in my solutions and those are perfectly tight. Ordered the same size with these and they feel a little bigger, but not too big to be a problem.
review.name: Great Purchase...10/10

review.reviewBody: I bought this shoe about a year ago to use for speed climbing.  This shoe performs amazingly and I love that 85% of the materials are recycled.  Even though these shoes were taking a beating while training speed climbing, they have lasted surprisingly long.
review.name: Great Speed Shoe

review.reviewBody: I've been using these as my gym shoes. I wear a 46 street shoe and ordered 43.5 after trying them on. I like a tight shoe but I'm older than 20 -something...therefore tight within reason. They stretched predictably and are perfect. I have very "boney" outside ankle bones so the rand around the ankle was too high and cut sharply into my ankle...a sharp utility knife remedied that and I have made similar accommodations in other footwear.
review.name: Can't beat a classic !

review.reviewBody: These are very good climbing shoes and I highly recommend them. But be weary of sizing, I would recommend going for a 1.5 size smaller than your regular shoes because they WILL stretch. Also they will turn your feet very brown.
review.name: Very Good Shoes

name: Cobra Eco Climbing Shoe

review.itemreviewed: CB Neo Power RTR Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Got these at the start of summer. Started off biking shorter distances and they weren't bad, average bib. After my first long ride with them (72 miles, Tahoe lake lap), when I went to remove the bibs, they were nearly stuck to my skin due to the fact that the stitches had actually penetrated my skin. They have a x like cross stitch on them and from my mid thigh to my waist I actually was cut from the bibs and bleeding. I immediately stopped using the bibs at this point. I will never again be buying any Louis Garneau products
review.name: Don't buy

name: CB Neo Power RTR Bib Short - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have narrow feet but fit perfect for me. The grip is perfect for grass and mud and still fast when moving from the road
review.name: Amazing grip for a mix of trail and road

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: it fits long - suggest going 1/2 size down. otherwise apart from that really nice feel u see foot.
review.name: fits a little long, size down

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
very light shoes,but too tight toobox,
not waterproof version,
I hope adidas making wide fit as well
review.name: quality ok,size small

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Shoes look fake soon I get it I saw the difference and I didn't like that .
review.name: Bad

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my second pair, absolutely loved my first pair and now that they are nearing 1000km this second pair are for upcoming trail races. Brilliant fast and comfortable shoes which seem to have lasted really well. My only gripe is that they have always felt quite wide fitting for someone who prefers a B width and would love future iterations to be available in a narrower fit.
review.name: Best trail race shoes ever.

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Comfortable, fast and keeps you rolling through your stride. Great fun on the road as well.

Havnt tried any technical trails in them yet but for light trails/ parkruns and even road running they are a perfect all round shoe.

Already recommended to a friend and she purchased some straight away and also loved them!
review.name: The only trail shoe Iâve enjoyed wearing!

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] After using my Boston 12s for a 100miler event I thought it would be worth investing in these. Great for what they are intended but can be a bit unstable on technical trail. I do struggle a bit to lock the heels in but it's no big deal
review.name: Would recommend

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Smooth ride, breathable, comfortable,  good propulsion, good grip on technical terrain, advances a feeling of sure-footedness
review.name: Efficient design

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Feels superfast, and so easy on the feet, even after long runs in the mountain.
review.name: Super shoe!

review.itemreviewed: Terrex Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very supportive in the arch and when you walk itâs like your springing along. They have a fantastic grip on slippery surfaces.
review.name: Propelled Springs Underfoot

name: Terrex Agravic Speed Ultra Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I am obsessed with these shoes! So comfortable and the color did not disappoint!
review.name: Love These Clifton Shoes

review.reviewBody: I can see now what the hype is about. Very supportive, cushioned and amazingly light weight. Highly recommended!
review.name: Instantly comfortable

review.reviewBody: I love the fit and the comfort. I am an elementary teacher and i am on my feet all day. I wish to a "slip-in" style. Thank you for the makers of Hoka!!!
review.name: I would buy this product again and again.

review.reviewBody: I thought I knew my feet but I was terribly wrong cause when I put on a pair of Hoka's I was in love. I enjoy wearing these Clifford's. They are amazing.....
review.name: Best Shoes Ever !!!!

review.reviewBody: I'm a serial Clifton 8 purchaser and frustrated that they are no longer available. I'm glad the Clifton 9s fit just as well. I like the the heel seems to protrude out the back less than the C8.
review.name: Great Replacement

review.reviewBody: Giving 3 stars because I love this shoe except it's already coming apart in less than 2 months. The worst part has been trying to return for replacement. Emails get kicked back. Try to text, NO RESPONSE. Try to live chat, NO RESPONSE!!! You have to return to UPS store and wait for approval b4 you get a new pair sent. Not good customer care for expensive shoes. Took far too much of my time trying to deal with this. VERY ANNOYING. SO DISAPPOINTING
review.name: Falling apart in less than 2 months

review.reviewBody: I love, love, love my Clifton 9 Hokas, but I wish I selected another color. Mine are too bright for my taste.
review.name: I would buy Hokas again.

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased my first pair of HOKA shoes. I love them. What I love most about them is the thick supportive sole of these shoes. I did need to stretch one shoe to conform to a foot issue but they have worked out great. They are very comfortable and have great support.
review.name: First time buyer

review.reviewBody: I use during my training sessions at the gym. Or for walks. Most comfortable, stable and supportive shoes, ever!
review.name: I Now Have 3 Pairs of These Shoes!

review.reviewBody: This is my third pair of Clifton 9s. I put about 1000 miles on the second pair. The sole started falling apart... but well worth the cost! They're great!! I order a half size smaller because they run big.
review.name: Great shoes!

name: Clifton 9 Wide Running Shoe - Women's

description: Buy the KEEN Venice H2 Hiking Shoe - Kids' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Venice H2 Hiking Shoe - Kids'
hasVariant.description: Buy the KEEN Venice H2 Hiking Shoe - Kids' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Love the Venice H2
Most comfortable and best fit of all the styles!
review.name: Great fit

review.reviewBody: Bought my girls matching pairs.. they donât complain about their feet hurting. Durable, spacious even for wide feet!
review.name: Comfy!

review.reviewBody: My grandson loves them. Heâs 9 & heâs been wearing Keen sandals every spring & summer since he was 2. Itâs held up in every way. Heâs a camper, hiker, frog catcher, all the things kids love to do without their shoes falling apart. Plus I love them because they protect his toes, stay on his feet and are simply bulletproof.
review.name: Just the best!

review.reviewBody: My sons summer shoes for the beach and camp are wonderful. Very well made, and are comfy. Past water shoes weâve purchased for him have left big blisters. Not these!!
review.name: Comfortable and Sturdy

review.reviewBody: In my opinion this is the best all-around style that Keen makes. It is a great-looking summer sandal and sturdy enough for to take on long walks. I live in mine. Just sad that the quit making them for adults. Please bring back the adult Venice!
review.name: Please bring back the adult Venice

review.reviewBody: They fit perfectly. I have very small feet (2) and so these are Junior shoes, but my goodness they are the most comfortable shoes I have ever worn! They were so comfy I wanted to wear them all day. I bought these as summer 'house shoes' as the other ones I go out walking in. So so comfortable... i will need a new pair of winter ones before the winter is out. Best find ever for a lady with arthritic small feet!
review.name: Like putting on the comfiest slippers ever!

review.reviewBody: Best shoes ever! Traveled to Costa Rica and needed versatile footwear. They did not disappoint.
review.name: Awesome shoes

review.reviewBody: I ordered these shoes because I loved the design and color palette. I ordered the Big Kid's size 5 (I wear women's size 7) and they fit perfecy. Unfortunately my little toe on each foot was left open and exposed. The straps should be closer especially around the toes. I had to return and ordered the Big Kid's Newport H2 which I totally love because they have much better toe coverage.
review.name: Exposed toe

review.reviewBody: We had been buying the Merrell Hydro H2O sandals for both our kids for the past few summers. These ones are so much better, the foot bed is a plastic type material instead of fabric and therefore it doesnât get stinky throughout the summer like the Merellâs do. Both kids say theyâre more comfortable too. If you are comparing each brand, I would most definitely go with these!
review.name: Better than Merrell!

review.reviewBody: I'm 67 and wear Keen's 95% of my life and have since 2008. My feet are wide so I can only wear the Venice style. I do not like shopping for shoes so when I find something I like, I stick with them. As a retired non-profit manager with a really small Social Security check, I decided to try some big kids Keens because they are more affordable. Overall they work well. The strapping is different but they are fun and I enjoy them and I will most likely buy another pair in a few more years. Runs large. DO NOT STOP MAKING VENICE PLEASE! Thanks!
review.name: Pank Panther

name: Venice H2 Hiking Shoe - Kids'

review.reviewBody: I have loved many higher end womens tanks . However, I ordered and received my first Elevate Lightweight Tank today. I haven't taken it off. The fabric is super soft, mildly stretchy, just the right length, arm openings not gaping with your bra completely exposed, I could go on and on. I immediately went on line to order more. ALL GONE in my size. BooHooHoo. My new favorite brand.
review.name: OMG!!!

review.reviewBody: Lightweight (but not paper thin), slightly cropped (but not too short), great silhouette. True to size (I sized down on the elevate tee, but bought my normal size in the tank & glad I did). Would buy again in other colors.
review.name: Great tank!

review.reviewBody: I loved the fabric. Very comfortable, I even bought one for my daughter in law.
review.name: Great feel

review.reviewBody: I love the cropped look, but still long enough to cover me. Itâs very lightweight, breathable material and super comfy.
review.name: Lightweight tank

review.reviewBody: I love the at it feels and fits - washes really well!
review.name: My third color-

review.reviewBody: Love this tank. Great weight and fit. Works well alone or under a shirt on chillier mornings.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: This is so confortable and soft ! I wore it to a theme park. It was pefect !
review.name: Perfect fit!

review.reviewBody: A very nice lightweight tank with a great fit! Not too boxy or too tight and covers most normal bra straps. Would love some other colors like the bright clay! Most colors that are offered are too washed out for my pale skin and the heather birch felt see through so I sent it back. Kept the green one and would probably like the smoke color! I have a wardrobe full of Free Fly! My go to performance and comfort wear!
review.name: Love the weight and the fit!

review.reviewBody: Nice and light weight, soft and an attractive fit. I bought a small and I am right at 120 lbs. Will purchase in more colors.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: Love this tank! So soft ,comfy and cool! Fit was perfect!
review.name: So comfy

name: Elevate Lightweight Tank Top - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I purchased these pants in a size 2 short which fit perfectly.  I am a small frame person and finding pants that look and feel right is a challenge.  I was happy to find this pair on BC

Unfortunately the pants were not a size 2, even though marked as such. So hoping BC will offer me a full refund even though I am  returning without the tags. Live and learn, once again to try everything on before you remove the tags and toss said tags into the bin.
review.name: Love these pants.

review.reviewBody: My daughter buys Prana pants for hiking with her dog. I liked the look of the pants on her so ordered my own. They are durable and lightweight for many seasons. Very versatile pants!
review.name: Love this pant

review.reviewBody: My daughter and both have these pants. She is 5â8â and stick thin. She wears a size  6T. Iâm a 5â4â 145 lb pear, and I wear a size 10. This style looks good on both of us.  Whoâda thunkâ¦
review.name: Versatile fit

review.reviewBody: one of the few brands that actually have long enough inseam for me (5'11").  Very comfortable - I bought one in each color that was available in my size.
review.name: great for tall girls

review.reviewBody: Material is nice but the pants were weirdly large/baggy in the crotch.  The zip pocket in the front is also too small to carry a phone, which is a shame.
review.name: Weird fit

review.reviewBody: I bought these for an upcoming trip to Ireland.  I think they will be perfect
review.name: Super comfortable pants

review.reviewBody: I have long legs, athletic build, these pants fit! Light weight for warm temps & they simply look nice
review.name: Perfect pants

review.reviewBody: These are wonderfully well designed and stylish for a hiking pant. The material and color are lovely and the stretch is ideal for when you want to look stylish but need a technical pant for hiking and scrambling. They are true to size with just the right amount of room for activity, however, the length is above my ankle! I think Iâll keep them because I like them so much, but being 5â6â and a size 6 (140 lb) I donât usually need to order a tall.
review.name: Well designed and stylish!

review.reviewBody: So satisfied with this pants. Very comfy!
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: Older versions fit perfectly.  New design has gigantic hips, so they look pretty ridiculous on me.  Glad I got them on sale
review.name: Prana changes design.  Boo!

name: Halle II Straight Pant - Women's

hasVariant.name: Khroma Kinetic Jacket - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Rab Khroma Kinetic Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket. Waterproof with just a bit of stretch. I rode all season in this, and it was perfect. From snow storms to spring days, it did everything great. The only thing - the cuffs are small and struggle to fit over under-the-cuff cloves. It would be nice if they were bigger and able to use a velcro closure. Beyond that - the pit zips are in a weird, but nice place. It allows venting when moving without rushing cold air into the body. the double zipper is a nice bonus. And the double chest pockets are huge - and includes a pass-through in one of them.
review.name: Perfect, save for one thing

review.reviewBody: Very nice jacket, fits well (but just a bit on the larger size).
review.name: Very nice jacket, fits well

hasVariant.description: Buy the Lake CX332 Cycling Shoe - Women's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: They are a beautiful shoe and sizing is perfect. But when I tried riding in them, first thing was the little plastic piece that the boa cord goes thru was rubbing on my big toe. Next, my foot actually moved too much causing hot spots. Maybe if my muscles in my foot were used to the movement.  I'm going to give one more try before I say absolutely no.
review.name: Wanted to love

review.reviewBody: Years ago my feet outgrew my first pair of Lake cycling shoes and I've been looking for a replacement ever since. I had high hopes for the CX332 women's shoes but had to return them because the toe box wasn't wide enough. Additionally, I wasn't crazy about the fit using the two Boa system because from your instep to toes it's just one adjustment. I found that in order to snug up my instep my toes were also tightend (too much). I ordered a men's wide, which are better wodth wise, but I think I may end up with a heel slip issue. I wish they'd make a women's wide! Still searching.
review.name: Still Searching

review.reviewBody: Happy I made the purchase! Highly recommend them. I love the fit, they are super comfortable and they're an absolutely beautiful shoe. I get constant compliments on them. My bike is purple and red, I have a good pair of red shoes (another brand) and now these beauties! Drop the mic...DONE!
review.name: They're comfortable and beautiful!

review.reviewBody: It is good looking shoes but not comfortable.
review.name: Good looking shoes

name: CX332 Cycling Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: These boots met my expectations and more! They kept my feet warm, dry and comfortable- even with over 10 miles of walking with the âbreak-inâ period. Amazing, I am so happy.
review.name: Keeps my feet toasty!

review.reviewBody: True to size. Comfortable even the first hour of walking around town on snowy sidewalks. Looks stylish. Glad I purchased them!
review.name: Great boots

review.reviewBody: These boots are great. They fit true to size - I?m a 10 and they fit great with room for heavy socks, too. The treading is decent for moderate terrain and snow. I could wear them on compacted snow trails in 20 degree Vermont weather and was warm enough and had good grip. My feet are always cold and these surprisingly kept them warm for several hours outdoors. They?ve been great for the ski mountain, everyday wear in the snow (shoveling, errands, etc). The real reason I got them is for taking the kids sledding - haven?t put them to that ultimate test yet but I think they?ll be good after trying them in these other environments first. I also bought the North Face Shellista II Mid Boots because the reviews had been good and returned them in both sizes I tried. They were not nearly as comfortable and were a very awkward fit. I would get these Helly Hansen?s again in a second.
review.name: Warm, functional boots

name: Garibaldi Vl Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Good warm bootie and easy to walk around in, I wanted them to be a touch warmer but they still do the trick!
review.name: Solid Bootie

review.reviewBody:
I bought a pair of these for both myself and my husband. They are pretty close to perfect for cold-weather camping when you donât want to struggle with shoes to go outside in the middle of the night.

I took away one star for two reasons. The first is that they are a little hard to get on because of the elastic band around the ankle. i would have liked to see a zipper or drawstring incorporated at the ankle so they were easier to slide on, but still cinched up tight once your foot was in.

The second drawback is the sole is a little flimsy. Itâs just a few layers of soft padding so they definitely wouldnât keep your foot safe from stepping on a sharp rock or twig. Ouch! That said, I love that the sole is smooth with no tread. This keeps them from tracking dirt and debris into the tent and makes them strong contenders for sleeping in when itâs bitter cold outside. 

All in all, I really like these and am excited to put them through the wringer during our upcoming Wyoming trip.

Also: I wear a womenâs size 10; mediums fit me well but were a teeny bite snug. My husband wears menâs size 11/11.5 and the large fit him perfectly.
review.name: Great for sleeping

name: Puffer Bootie

review.reviewBody: Sadly, I have worn through a sole already in less than 2 monthsâ¦of climbing outside (2?) days per week only. Iâve been told basically âtoo bad so sadâ by Backcountry. Not thrilled.
review.name: Wore through sole in 1.5 months

review.reviewBody: This is my 5th pair, love them to death. Canât say enough good things.
review.name: So reliable

review.reviewBody: Despite the more aggressive fit, they are still comfy for climbing shoes. It was a fairly easy break in period and they seemed to last for quite awhile.  I am a street size 10 and I got these in 41 (9.5 Womans).
review.name: Great shoe!

review.reviewBody:
I?m pretty sure these shoes helped me break the 11a barrier. I got them to have something a little more aggressive than my TC Pros for shorter routes and bouldering. These did not disappoint. Despite the more aggressive fit, they are still comfy for climbing shoes. Once I got them broken in the rubber had fantastic grip and the downturned shape allows me to use my toes for even the smallest holds. 

I am a street size 10 and I got these in 41.5
review.name: like a talon

review.reviewBody: I'm currently on my third pair. They are so comfortable, aggressive, good for the gym and outside. I just love them so much!
review.name: BEST SHOES EVER. PERIOD.

review.reviewBody: Otaki in Japanese Samurai slang is the oldest single wire sword: extremely sharp and precise also on small targets.  A concept perfectly applicable to climbing: Otaki is a precise, supportive and structured climbing shoe, ideal for climbing in crags, on walls and boulders thanks to features that meet the requirements of today's modern climbers. The new construction method combines the advantages of the all round snug fit of a slipper to the precision and volume regulation of a Velcro closure shoe.  This solution guarantees maximum sensitivity and precision even in torsion: the shoe perfectly follows the movements of the climber eliminating empty volumes and rigid zones. The Innovative S-Heel? allows to maintain perfect torsion stability accentuating performance and adaptability in heel hooks when bouldering.
review.name: Otaki product video

name: Otaki Climbing Shoe - Women's
Otaki Climbing Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: the baby was cold, but not anymore. Good gift for my lil nephew. Plus his parents dig it
review.name: makes a baby even cuter, plus warm

review.reviewBody: Adorable WARM outfit for my grandson, he also looks so cute in it and gets lots of compliments, functional and beautiful!
review.name: ADORABLE outfit and WARM

review.reviewBody: love this for the cold but not super cold days. had it with my 3 year old, bought it again for my new baby.
review.name: bought this twice!

review.reviewBody: Extremely warm esp in the car and carseat I bought for my son in 2021 and will buy for my daughter this year
review.name: This extremely warm if live in north as myself

review.reviewBody: Love these NF body suits, had a 6-9M one and def bought a larger size for a trip to a colder climate. Her older sister has the matching zip up jacket and love how they match
review.name: Soft and easy to put on!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect for infants in the winter! Very comfy and can wear everyday with any under garments
review.name: Definitely would buy this again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Cute color and super soft , like a pastel baby blue
review.name: Cute osito

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This one piece works great for our toddler. We use it to play in the yard or go on hikes and it keeps her very warm and cozy. Very pretty color, too!
review.name: I would buy again!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this outfit for our 12 month old! The 12-18 month size is a pretty big on her but she will get lots of use out of it. It's so easy to slip on over her outfit when we are heading to the zoo, park, etc. My sister has this outfit and it's lasted for 3 kids so I'm hoping to get years of memories in it.
review.name: Quality is worth the price

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fuzzy, soft, and adorable. The blue is lighter in color than I expected.
review.name: Fuzzy and soft

name: Campshire One-Piece Suit - Infants'

hasVariant.description: Buy the Bogs Rancher Boot - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable. Work outside in the elements and my feet stay warm.
review.name: Comfort

review.reviewBody: Boots are the same boots I purchased before. Good fit. I like my boots a little larger to accommodate extra thick socks for Iowa winters and they're not too big for summer. Very comfortable. Very durable. Will buy again. Thank you, Bogs!
review.name: Easy purchase, decent shipping, good boots

review.reviewBody: These boots are very comfortable and work well. Very warm and keep your feet dry. The drawback of most of Bogs products, be it boots or shoes is the only last a year and a half or so with regular use. The front pull straps end up ripping out on the shoes and both boot and shoes end up tearing and leaking where your foot bends.
review.name: Great show until they tear and break down.

review.reviewBody: Needed for winter. Easy to slip on and off. Warn and comfortable.
review.name: Necessity

review.reviewBody: Easy purchase. Decent price. Quick delivery. Love my boots! These are my second pair and still comfortable. Hopefully they last like my first pair. They were in pretty bad shape but almost 10 years old! And that's on the farm.
review.name: Durable, comfortable, fast and easy purchase

review.reviewBody: Keeps feet warm and dry during the winter months here in Colorado.
review.name: Practical

review.reviewBody: Love these boots, use them daily for working around the yard and stream. Can stand in the stream for hours and feet stay warm. Recently used them up above snow line for cutting a Christmas tree, wore only thin wool socks - feet and toes stayed warm. Bought 2 more pairs for my father and father-in-law.
review.name: Comfortable, warm boots with great traction.

review.reviewBody: Got this for my son-in-law and he loves it! It's a perfect fit, it's warm and waterproof!
review.name: Perfect fit, warm and dry

review.reviewBody: Better than the Classic, but this type only lasted 6 months. For such an expensive boot, you would think it would be made to last longer.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: Terrific boot, comfortable and very durable. Bogs was great to work with for my exchange for my perfect size. I will definitely purchase Bogs again!!! Thank you!
review.name: Terrific Boot

name: Rancher Boot - Men's

description: Buy the Thule Chariot Cross Stroller online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Chariot Cross Stroller
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Chariot Cross Stroller online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: My 8 mo old loves this thing. Super comfy with the bike hook up and extra kid insulation, baby is smiling and laughing every time we ride. Today was 24 degrees F and the chariot was pulling smoothly behind my studded 26â bike with my wife on her studded 27.5â. So glad I bought this and that babyâs first rides were at the peak of winter.
review.name: Chariot puts a smile on our faces

review.reviewBody: I got it a month ago. The Trailer is well made, and the single one is very compact. We used to have a Burley trailer, but the seat did not recline; it was too big and did not have rain cover. This thule Trailer has it all. A few things that may improve are the Bottom Fabric. It feels like it will break every time my toddler stands on it to get into the Trailer. It would be lovely if rain cover were part of the Trailer for easy on and off. Great Trailer. Very pricey but worth it.
review.name: Great Bike Trailer

review.reviewBody: I have always loved gear but I am new to the baby world and oh my do I love gear even more! This is the coolest piece of gear I have owned and could not be happier. It is easy to set up, transition, and I feel like it somehow makes me a faster runner?! It is so light and well made. I have told all my friends about it.
review.name: OMG The Coolest Gear I Own

review.reviewBody: So happy with this purchase! We live on a dirt road and the jogging wheel and infant sling puts provides such a smooth ride. Also, we love that itâs a fixed wheel as it creates better stability for jogging. I saw a reviewer make a negative comment about the fixed wheel, but itâs designed that why on purpose for jogging.
review.name: Great Add-On for the Chariot!

review.reviewBody: The cross has some great upgrades from the cougar. A couple things I would like to see improved stillâ¦ if you could give the running wheel a swivel option like my urban glide, Iâd just give you all my money. I live on a gravel road and the tiny stroller wheels are useless. I donât run though and find the fixed wheel a huge bummer. Im not crazy about the new covers situation or the cargo box either. Otherwise, love the improvements.
review.name: Almost perfect!

review.reviewBody:
Iâve been to cross country skiing with my 6 months baby multiple times and she loves it. She fell sleep or look around the snow! 
Thank you Thule making our trip possible.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: I've used the Thule Chariot as a jogger and bike trailer, carrying my 11mo daughter.  The design is sleek, sturdy, and attractive.  Minimalist in design, the cockpit is comfortable enough for her to fall asleep will traveling along a rural bike path.  The unit travels straight, without any structural concerns when going over bumps or uneven surfaces.  I'm impressed by the design and construction, and will consider the ski attachment.
review.name: Quality Equipment

review.reviewBody: We bought this for our twin girls in the hope to be more mobile and take them jogging, biking (and maybe cross country skiing!) and it did not disappoint. Easy to assemble, manoeuver and fold, this is the best and most versatile twin stroller Iâve come across.
review.name: Thule chariot cross - versatility at its best!

review.reviewBody:
Never thought I could be obsessed with a 'stroller'. I'm OBSESSED!

It's the perfect mode of transportation for the kiddos - it glides perfectly and set up is a breeze. The attachments are fantastic too!
review.name: Smooth as butter

review.reviewBody: I bought this before summer so we could haul our 1yo with us on our bike ride. Since then, we did travel a bit with it and made a lot of bike rides. This chariot does the job pretty well. Other then being a bit big when folded for travel (I have the 1 place) everything else is fine
review.name: Awesome all around chariot

name: Chariot Cross Stroller

review.reviewBody: I've only had one trip so I cant speak to durability but this bag is light, fits a lot of clothes and has 2 separate compartments that zip with mesh covers. Bag lies flat when opened so both sides are easily accessed. When loaded it does stand up on its own although it is not completely stable. So far I really like this bag and hope it lasts a long time.

review.reviewBody: Great size, will reach weight limit when full, rolls well, stands upright, mesh on both top and bottom compartments works great, would buy again!

description: Buy the DT Swiss Star Ratchet Upgrade Kit online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Star Ratchet Upgrade Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the DT Swiss Star Ratchet Upgrade Kit online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Star Ratchet Upgrade Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the DT Swiss Star Ratchet Upgrade Kit online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great upgrade to my DT Swiss hub. Super easy to install (5 minutes max) and worth the money. Way better power engagement. Helps a bunch on little tech sections where you need to half stroke to avoid a peddle strike.
review.name: DT Swiss Ratchet upgrade

review.reviewBody: I upgraded my Tarmac S-Works to the 54 tooth kit.  While I greased it well, I find that the lower count ratchets actually coast faster than my 54 tooth ones.  I think there is just more friction because there are more teeth.  That said, it is a bit handy in a group ride setting where you may need to slow but don't need to hit the brakes.  I think the upgrade was worth it, but don't expect a faster coast because of it.  You'll slow faster while coasting, but this is not bad necessarily.
review.name: Better...But not what I expected

review.reviewBody: Arrived very quickly. It was super easy to uninstall my previous 18t ratchet and install the new 36t ratchet. Anyone can do it (besides, many YouTube videos show how to exactly do it). I find the price a bit high for what it is but, after looking at other online stores, none comes lower than Competitive Cyclist and I trust this store more than any other store for bicycle-related products.
review.name: DT Swiss 36t Star Ratchet

review.reviewBody: Love this quick and easy upgrade. Its not the cheapest let's face it, but will it give your bike more engagement climbing and a slight buzzy nosie with is nice. We're always in the hills so i appreciate less drag from the cranks. Looking forward to that 54 maybe...
review.name: More Buzz for the bucks!

review.reviewBody:
I see many comments slinging their way around on this thread, so let me give you my smack.
I ride road and I ride Campagnolo and of course a DT Swiss hub on my Lightweights and let me say that while I moved from the stock 18T up to the 36T it is quite an improvement when instant engagement means everything -- however, I wish I would have gone to the 54T. Even though the difference, ratio-wise, is little more than a hairs-difference, I still need it.  
As far as noise in concerned, that depends on your frame -- I run Lightweight carbon wheels on a magnesium frame, and yes, it does sound like a rage of bees swarming, the frame helps with this echo though.

Bottom line, IMO, if you're going to make the move go straight up 54T and break down with the extra few bucks -- you won't be sorry.

Cheers!
review.name: The special sauce, indeed!

review.reviewBody: Was quite surprised by how much difference this made on my wheel. A lot more snappy when changing climbing cadence and quite more engagement while spinning above 95RPM or so.
review.name: Great addition to my wheels-45t upgrade

review.reviewBody: I have 2 sets of wheels for my 2016 Specialized Diverge Pro. One setup for the road and the 2nd for trails/gravel. Put this in the gravel wheels. Will you notice the 9g savings in rotating weight? Hell no. Will you notice the faster engagement and the change in tone sound wise. YES. I like it! I always prefer the ratchet design over the pawl designs with the âangry beesâ annoyance. Your call if it is worth the rather steep price. Now I have the âofficialâ DT Swiss grease. Ha! Any different that the white lithium grease Iâve been using? Who knows? Iâm enjoying the switch!
review.name: Nice addition to your gravel/trail setup

name: Star Ratchet Upgrade Kit

hasVariant.name: Transit Pant - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Showers Pass Transit Pant - Women's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I pulled these out of the bag, and they were massive. I usually buy small or medium pants, based off of size charts. I opted for mediums here since Storms Pass suggests going up a size if planning to wear these pants over clothes. I don't know who these sizes were modelled after, but this medium is NOT a normal medium. It wears more like an XL. Put them right back in the bag. 
Never got to test the water-proof-ness of them, but I'll say that the pants look much more fitted in the photos online than they are in-person. Not sure I would spend over $100 for these just based on looks.
review.name: Way way way too big

name: Transit Pant - Women's

description: Buy the Louis Garneau Cb Carbon Lazer Bib Short - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Cb Carbon Lazer Bib Short - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Louis Garneau Cb Carbon Lazer Bib Short - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Cb Carbon Lazer Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have been a big fan of LG carbon bibs. I have 2 pair of Carbon 2 that hat seen their yrs of use and held up great. This time I went with a Medium Carbon Lazer vs the 2.  The 2 things I noticed was. The chamois feels a little thinner vs the 2 but that could be me. Probably the biggest thing for me on why it is not a 5 star is the length.  What I mean is the leg length is too long coming down to my knees. Again maybe this is me but the CB 2 had the right length and not an issue. Both the 2 and Carbons fit true to fit medium wise. It is just the length in the legs that are annoying or this would be a 5 star
review.name: Maybe it is me

name: Cb Carbon Lazer Bib Short - Men's
