description: Buy the Mountain House Biscuits and Gravy online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Biscuits and Gravy
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain House Biscuits and Gravy online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought so many for all dif reason but it's hard saving them. They taste so good I find myself going into my stash and eating them all the time
review.name: Love the biscuits & gravy

review.reviewBody:
Sodium: 2940mg / 128%
Okay, I just consumed 128% of my daily-recommended allowance of Salt in ONE MEAL.  What do I do for the rest of the day?? Hmm...  Since you only get a yes/no option for recommending to a friend, I'm going to have to give it a solid "depends".  If they are like me, with a high blood-pressure issue, then definitely not.  If they are expedition/mountain-climbing, then yes.
review.name: Great taste, BUT...

review.reviewBody: Tastes good. On a hunt I eat the whole pouch. For me just the right amount of spice. Better than the new one.
review.name: Great breakfast

review.reviewBody: I worked for emergency essentials and we sold mountain house. Literally all their food is the best tasting, filling and easiest to prepare. mac&cheese, bisquits and gravy, chili mac, I could go on and on! Delicious. Now the hard part, trying to store, not eat it!
review.name: love it!

review.reviewBody: I love the taste of Biscuits & Gravy, truth be told, I love all the Mountain House meals, but even though they have a long shelf life I'm having trouble saving my Biscuits & Gravy. I highly recommend all the Mountain House meals.
review.name: excellent

review.reviewBody: The classic B&G was very good and not a disappointment.  The flavor was there but a bit bland.  A little salt and pepper brought it to life.  Would recommend this to anyone who enjoys B&G
review.name: Classic Biscuit and Gravy

name: Biscuits and Gravy

review.reviewBody:
I'm a small volume, narrow 13 in every shoe but with these I have contact with my small toes on the outside - feels like a size too small. 

I like the design, and have heard good things about OluKai, but was rather shocked at how heavy these shoes are, which seems to be mostly in the footbed of the shoe. For comparison these are heavier than my leather/Goretex hiking boots. Also not sure how the 'quilted lining' inside will hold up over time - would have preferred none, or a leather lining. Will return.
review.name: Odd sizing, HEAVY

name: Papaku 'Ili Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: i mtn bike about twice a week for 2-3 hours. my butt was getting sore because all my very old chamois had no padding left. My butt is happy again; these offer ample padding. I was pleasantly surprised by the nice, thin, stretchy, comfortable material of the main shorts; way nicer than the standard thicker Lycra. And they are opaque so can be worn without overshorts if needed.
review.name: perfect liner shorts

review.reviewBody: I love love love the montcham shorts but my size was sold out so I got the drift shorts too. As the other review mentioned they are a ?2hr? short but I?ve worn them for longer rides and I do notice a little discomfort over the montcham shorts but only slightly. The drift shorts are pretty darn comfy and the price is superb. Breathable, good cut, doesn?t roll up and they are comfy. The waistband is comfy too. Good buy.
review.name: Nice shorties

name: Drift Short - Women's

description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Mission Rover 45L Pack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Mission Rover 45L Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Mission Rover 45L Pack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love the bag. Great size and easy to travel with. However, there are a bit too much compartments for the size. With my use, few of the pouches will never get used before the bag getting full. Besides that, great quality and durable looking bag.
review.name: Great bag for traveling

review.reviewBody: Bought to use for multi-day buisness trips. 45L bag was advertised as largest carry on size and it fits perfectly in overhead bins when loaded out. Itâs a tight fit in the smaller jets like the CRJ but it works.
review.name: 45L Mission Rover

review.reviewBody: Please make the laptop compartment out of some other material, spandex or whatever yoga pants are made of. I got the bag for buissness and travel needs and although I love the compartments I still need to bring another bag for the office gear. Please Fix.
review.name: Laptop doesn't fit in the pocket designed for it

review.reviewBody: Old travel backpack was actually falling apart at the seams after decades of service as a carry on and as an improvised backpacking pack. To upgrade the backpacking and hauling I decided to go with Mystery Ranch because...... well they're Mystery Ranch. We have been using them so long for their tremendous packs that some of them even say Dana Designs. After some research I landed on the Rover so it would be the right size, After one week long trip, I couldn't be happier. The Zoid cubes fit perfectly, and I have never been more organized. I love everything about the bag! OK I would have preferred the brown color, but it was sold out because everyone else felt the same way.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: I bought this for travel and it is a great pack loaded with good inside features.  It could use some external pockets/storage.
review.name: Great Travel Pack

review.reviewBody: Purchased these for our team travels and are super impressed with the quality, durability, versatility, and overall utility of this bag. Whether for business or pleasure, these bags are going to last!!!
review.name: Killer bag, swallows a ton of gear!

review.reviewBody: I got my Mission Rover about two weeks ago and have used it twice. The first trip was by car - I was gone for six days - the Mission Rover handled all of my clothes with no issue. The design allowed me to keep a second pair of shoes and even my dirty laundry separated from my clean clothes. The second trip was only for three days, and I went by aircraft. The Mission Rover fit in the overhead compartment without issue and held everything I needed. I couldn't be happier with the pack.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a high quality bag of the perfect size for a carry-on that would easily hold everything I needed for at least a week. This definitely delivered.I recently was on a week-long trip for the first time with the bag and it performed nicely. The material and zippers are of high quality. Paired with some packing cubes I was able to get everything I needed into this bag neatly along with two laptops and an extra set of shoe. Importantly, I was able to easily fit it into the overhead bin on the airplane. However, only addition I wish it had was compression straps so I could've reduced it's profile a bit more in the case it was one of the smaller airplanes with smaller overhead bins.
review.name: High quality Carry-on Bag Found!

review.reviewBody: Very thoughtful features and the perfect size for a weekend carry on bag.  Good quality as well.  This is my second one of these, with the other being the largest size.
review.name: Very nice weekend pack

review.reviewBody: Great internal layout for travel. Could use 1-2 exterior mesh pockets for water bottle etc.
review.name: Good pack

name: Mission Rover 45L Pack

description: Buy the RockyMounts AfterParty 2-Bike Hitch Rack online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: AfterParty 2-Bike Hitch Rack
hasVariant.description: Buy the RockyMounts AfterParty 2-Bike Hitch Rack online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I was pretty disappointed that it showed up chipped. Seemed to be packaged well and the package itself wasnât damaged. The powdercoat was chipped in multiple spots though. Really a bummer when youâre paying this much for a rack. 

That aside the function has been great. Itâs sturdy. I have no doubts my bikes will make it to the destination on this rack. Assembly was a breeze. I really like that there is no frame contact. It fits a 24 tundra well and swings out of the way of the tailgate to access the bed. 

Overall very happy with it but wish QC with the paint was better.
review.name: Great Sturdy Rack

review.reviewBody: I bought this rack over the Kuat Piston, and One Up. Though I did by the One Up single rack for every day use. Unfortunately I chose this one for the swing out feature and the one handed lock tab. use works great however the swing mechanism is almost useless if you were using it anything other campsite camping. Itâs to dang difficult to screw it back in with any weight at all on it. So if your planning on just heading out to the trail head or ride start and getting it out of the way of your tailgate regularly you can hang it up. You have to literally lay on the ground and maneuver the rack around to get the threaded screw to line upâ¦ thereâs literally barely any pilot shaft on the screw to help you. Total bummer. I would trade this rack in a second for the standard guide rail. Save you money and do the same and get the guide rail. Great idea not the best implementation. Bummer is I have already owned it for over a year hoping to give some time to work it. Rocky Mounts even said thatâs just kind of how it is and try to hold it slightly to the right? Maybe they shouldâve made right I thoughtâ¦.hmmm? Keep in mind the rest of the rack is fantastic. But the guide and the Kuat swing out and you will have a much more functional setup. For about the same price though it will stick out a little further. But it will work as hopedâ¦.:)
review.name: Cool Idea Missed

review.reviewBody:
Don't let the shiny blue anodized parts give you the impression this is a quality product and (mostly copied) design. 

When I first unpacked the boxes labeled China I couldn't help think how expensive this product is compared to some of the others manufactured here in the US. Were talking about a rack that is $1100 here folks so it is natural to have high expectations. 

I've had the rack a few months and feel pretty confident it is not fit for purpose. It's a wobbly and rusting mess and I do not trust it with my bikes that are within the weight specifications. I even have a problem with my non-ebikes surprisingly. There is play at the interface for the extension, play at the interface for the tilting lock, and the trays shake wildly driving down the road. 

I contacted support where they were fairly quick to respond and agreed the movement looks more than expected and had me torque everything and, after a week or two of back-and-forth, basically said, "yeah, looks like that's just how your rack is" even after saying they thought the movement was excessive. 

I had to craft a door protector due to the amount of rocking the bikes experience going down the highway to prevent dents from my bars. It's probably a foot away from the door but can still make contact when the bikes start oscillating. 

My colleague has a 1up and I've had the Thule side arm style and neither has the amount of movement this disappointment has. I was really surprised by my experience given the questionably positive reviews. 

Watch the video and see for yourself. It's scary to watch the bikes swaying going down the highway in my rear camera.
review.name: A Wobbly Mess

review.reviewBody: Lightest swing away out there because it is in integral with the rack. Holds two ebikes well. Still need to test it with light off roading but pretty sure it will be up to the task. I also easily modified a Yakima bike ramp to hook on to it for my ebike for ease of getting it on the platform.
review.name: Lightest swing away rack on the market

review.reviewBody: Amazing rack and very high quality materials used throughout (no plastic in sight and all metal contruction). The swing away feature is super easy to use even when bikes are loaded down. And the dual ratcheting arms are the best in the biz (better and much easier to use than my old 1UP USA model). I can only see one downside and that's the price. Expecting this to last through many many seasons of use.
review.name: Amazing rack!

name: AfterParty 2-Bike Hitch Rack

review.reviewBody: Loving this jacket so far! It's super visible and lightweight (for running), and I've discovered it's perfect for wintertime mtn bike riding as well. It makes soggy NW adventure possible!
review.name: Yes

review.reviewBody: I've been using this anorak for guiding up high in the White Mountains of NH for a few months. This jacket is light, attractive, and functional. It's waterproof and breathes well. Protects well from gusty winds. I regularly employ it in highly exposed areas on Mt Washington. Durable enough for guide/climbing use and light enough to justify for ultralight backpacking. The fit of the anorak is great. The hood works with or without a helmet. The wrist cuffs are minimal and effective. The stow pocket is sized for ease of use. The only thing I would add is a cinch around the waist hem. Other than that it has been a 9/10 anorak for the weight and receives compliments for looking good.  I may just pick up the full zip jacket as well. I like anoraks for 3 season and full zips for the fringe conditions as they are easier to put on when it's cold. I'm typically a medium in clothing and this medium is cut a little larger which is appropriate for an anorak to slide over from the top easily. It layers well over a baselayer, fleece, and synthetic vest all in size medium. Not restrictive which is critical for ninja moves.
review.name: Super Light for Alpine Use

review.reviewBody: light enough to run in, can handle rain to no end. packs so nice into its one pocket, hiked 4 miles with it in my hand and forgot it was there. replaced all my other rain jackets, love that it's recycled and not goretex also
review.name: seriously ultralight

review.reviewBody:
Love this jacket! 

Fits great. Looks very cool. Minimal features. It does not have hand pockets on the lower portion making ideal for going under a harness or a backpack hip belt. Its lightweight construction makes it pack super small. Youâll forget itâs even in your pack! 

My favorite parts of this jacket:
-The wrist cuff Velcro closing system. Works very well and easy to manage with gloves on.
-Mobility. Not restricting movement. Great for climbing.
review.name: Premium Level Ultralight Mountain Shell.

review.reviewBody: Light Anorak style three layer hardshell that fits nicely under harness. Packs down into its chest pocket. Great for the person who likes to keep things minimal and functional.
review.name: Light and waterproof.

name: Premonition UL Anorak - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Zulu 45L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I wanted a slightly larger pack for winter as I end up carrying more things, and this fits the bill! It has a different design compared to the Zulu 35, and the pouches and pockets are slightly different, but overall, this makes it easier to use. I did notice that the glasses holder on the shoulder strap has been deleted, which is a shame, but overall, this is a great pack to add to the gear closet and trails!
review.name: A good upgrade from a Zulu 35

review.reviewBody: The pack was awesome, lots of easy access and love the front fold out zip to get anywhere in your pack easily. Even though itâs a 45L pack, for someone with all ultralight gear, itâs perfect for multi night or just one. Pack was also super comfortable on my back and hips!
review.name: perfect beginner or experienced backpacking pack

review.reviewBody: Iâve had the smaller 30L version of this pack for years and have been very happy with it.  My wife and son just purchased, on closeout, last years 40L Zulu and we were very impressed with the size of the side and hip belt pockets along with a very comfortable suspension system. In addition, they came with an included rain cover.  In order to get the size I needed, I ordered this yearâs âupgradedâ 45L version.  Unfortunately, this great pack no longer comes with a rain cover.  What gives?
review.name: Great comfortable packâ¦Whereâs the rain cover???

review.reviewBody: Love the pack but the chest strap is cheaply made. Wish I had checked the reviews before purchasing . I definitely do not recommend this product. I also have the the Jade 38 and pray that the strap is better made than the Zulu 45
review.name: I Do not recommend Gregory Zulu 45
comment: Thanks for leaving the review.  A broken sternum strap is covered under our warranty policy.  Please contact our customer service team so we can take next steps.

review.reviewBody: Solid pack, carryâs weight well.  Runs a little small but adjustable.
The clip for adjusting chest strap height snapped off first time adjusting it, can't find replacement clips which is crazy seeing as it is made so flimsy. Very dissatisfied
review.name: Zulu 45 chest strap broken
comment: Thanks for leaving your feedback.  Please contact our customer service team so we can take next steps.

review.reviewBody: seems like its well built and should hold up to daily use for seasons to come
Needed a bigger pack to haul all my stuff to mountain for ski patrol. This packs holds lots, love that I can access it via the zipper.  adjustable and comfortable. Time will tell if it holds up
review.name: Pack

review.reviewBody: Great for backpacking. Good balance between weight and features
review.name: Great pack

review.reviewBody: Iâve had Osprey bags in the past and just recently bought a Kelty bag that I returned. I came across the Zulu during my search, which definitely peaked my interest. Local store had one and I got the chance to try both Osprey and Zulu packs on in the store, all I can say is it really wasnât a tough decision. I donât have anything bad to say about Osprey packs, but, for me, the Zulu was in another league. I highly recommend, you wonât be disappointed!!
review.name: Wow!!

name: Zulu 45L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I bought 2 pairs about 18 months ago. Loved them, better than other merino wool boxers I have owned. Unfortunately I have noticed that the waistband is giving out. It has lost some of its stretch. Such a bummer because they are otherwise great.
review.name: Great - But Elastic Doesn't Last

review.reviewBody: These are amazing! 100% soft merino wool and very durable. So comfortable and warm.  They are pricey, however,  if you wait for a sale or use your points,  you can get them at a similar cost you'd pay for other merino briefs. The difference is these are 100% merino. Many companies will advertise their products as merino but then when you see the label they are really only 60% merino mixed with other materials.  My point is there is a difference and Ortovox IMHO makes the best quality outdoor gear.  I'm 6 foot but have a small waist and the small fits me well.  ( 165lbs athletic build) check out their size chart if you're not sure, their sizing is always right on point.  I would highly recommend these!
review.name: Awesome boxer briefs!

review.reviewBody: If youâre looking for a cozy, warm, comfortable, and DURABLE boxer for the mountains and outdoor activity, or even just day to day commutes in cold weather, then these are the ones you want. Iâve tried all the expensive ones and they rip easily and quickly. Yes these are pricey, but would you rather pay again and again for boxers? Or would you rather pay for a solid pair that will last you more than a few years?
review.name: My search is over

name: 185 Rock'N'Wool Boxer - Men's

review.reviewBody: Had an earlier version, was great, probably saved my life, but this one is even better, great features, very good airflow, and I love the integrated glasses holder. Not sure about the breakaway visor, itâs popped off piling gear on top and I didnât notice until I was on the trail.
review.name: Awesome helmet!

review.reviewBody: Been wearing the Tactic 4 helmet for the past year or so, fit on the Ambush 2 here is pretty similar but it feels a lot lighter and more breathable.  sunglasses also fit much better in the forehead vents than they did on the Tactic.  pretty shallow fit out of the box but you can slide the straps into 5 different positions to make it a bit deeper.
review.name: Ambush II

name: Ambush II Helmet

description: Buy the Eureka! Mountain Pass Tent: 2-Person 4-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Mountain Pass Tent: 2-Person 4-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Eureka! Mountain Pass Tent: 2-Person 4-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Coming from an older Eureka tent, this is a huge leap forward for me. This tent on its first weekend trip with 3 days and 2 nights held up in incredibly rainy weather while keeping me cool in warmer temps. The amount of ventilation that you can get through this tent with the rainfly on is beyond impressive. The vestibules are different sized each side. I have not had a second person in this tent with me yet but I could potentially see some problems with fitting both backpacks on one side and still having easy access. Plenty of pockets on the inside for storage, and incredibly easy setup and takedown. I really enjoyed getting to use this tent and now I'm planning more trips just so i have an excuse to use it even more.
review.name: A truly great tent well worth the price

review.reviewBody: This is a great tent. Unfortunately, one of the poles snapped one of the first nights I used it, due to an average rain storm. At least I was able to fix it myself with a metal tube, but I sure wish they wouldâve replaced my poles.
review.name: Good, but poles snapped
comment: Thank you for your review. We are sorry to hear about the frame damage and we invite you to contact Customer Service at 1-800-572-8822 to explore replacement options for the entire (integrated) frame.

review.reviewBody: Excellent tent with no flaws but always improvements that could be made. I have used if for around 150 days and I would only wish, that this tent had rip-stop on fabric and more of a bucket styled protective protective fabric to prevent water from flowing underneath.
review.name: Excellent tent

review.reviewBody: I bought this tent years ago for hunting in Alaska. It had done fantastic. Im in Utah now and it's great. Only complaint is the elastic in the tent poles is going out and I have to sinch them a lot.
review.name: Fantastic tent

review.reviewBody: I used this tent on my first cold weather camping experience. It got as cold at 14 degrees F with 20-30 mph winds at night. My water bottle did not freeze in the tent and I slept comfortably with a 20 degree bag and a blanket. The set up was easy and was able to do it rather quickly in the dark (got to the site late). With the winds, the tent was very secure, and was relatively quiet.
review.name: Used on my first cold weather camping

review.reviewBody: I bought this tent three years ago and love it.  I used it car camping, backcountry camping, winter camping and even use it several times with just the footprint and fly at the beach. (Great feature that should be displayed)  it been through it all and would buy it again. It has always kept me dry.  Had a tent stake break and wrote Eureka and mailed it and the replaced.  How can you get better service then that.   Love Euraka  and will be a life time Customer.
review.name: Versatile Tent

review.reviewBody: Have NOT yet used the tent. However, the overall impression is "bombproof". Improvements needed to be called "4 season": a) Fly must be longer to allow for snow to be used to seal the bottom against snow and wind. b) Fly should have two zippers, top and bottom. This allows for venting and when cooking in the vestibule during storms. c) The "clip" used to secure the tent to the pole hub is woefully inadequate: a trip-ender waiting to happen. Needs a backup provision when / if it snaps during cold weather (ie: a small metal carabiner) After all...it is JUST plastic, right? d) better seam tape on fly. e) closable, external thru-pocket for waste storage when tent / storm bound. Overall a Good Tent for California backpacking....especially for spring and fall trips in the Sierra....which is why I made this purchase. Quality is what I expect from Eureka.
review.name: Can not wait to use my new Eureka Mountain Pass 2

review.reviewBody: I bought this winter tent specifically for a Grand Canyon River trip. River camping often has sand storms that lead to sand raining down thru the no-see 'em netting. That part worked great, though the zippers are in kinda weird places --should be able to open from bottom or top. The cargo pockets by your pillow or feet are lacking. You need a place to put your schnadle. The "nifty" triangle add-on cargo net that hangs from the ceiling is silly. Leave it at home, it is useless. Seems like they tried to use up leftover pieces to make it. The tent has two doors on one side and one on the other. The door on the rain fly inexplicably does not open to the one door on the one door side of the tent. You have to reach far in to get to the zipper and crawl into the tiny vestibule to get in the tent from that side. Why not have the rain fly door match the tent door? There were not enough tent stakes for all the places to put them. Why 11? Good thing tent stakes are easily found in popular camping spots. Also, you need a hammer or some really thick leather gloves to push the tent stakes in. They are very sharp and will cut your hands unlike the wire ones that bend, not sure what is better.
review.name: Good for Sand Storms but ...

review.reviewBody:
Having used the MountainPass XTE for out scout troop as three+ season tents it was easy to make the jump to the MountainPass tent. It's not a straight comparison since this review is for the 2 person tent were as the XTE is a three person tent. 
Easy set up with hubbed pole system. Used the tent in temp's down to -10F as well as heavy moist snow fall at another event. Not sure how the "outrigger" roof poles would have done under the heavy snow fall on the three person tent. Dug out tents in middle of the night to play it save. It's not an expedition style 4 season tent, but other then that this tent suffice in all but the extreme conditions. The high vent does it's job. The stakes are V shape which is better than the round stakes. Like the other reviewer wrote about the zipper travel way; i agree. I would prefer as well to zip open (crack) from the top. Door mesh panels are partial mesh, at the bottom. I guess this is to promote better cross, low to high ventilation. Webbing is color coded to attach fly to tent and or ground cloth but it fit both ways, symmetrical. So it he wind direction changes 180Â° you can rotate the fly. This tent is definitely designed for snow. Night picture shows 2 person, day picture someone else's 3 person
review.name: Great tent for winter (and sand storms?)

review.reviewBody: Set this up in my backyard with gloves on to see how easy it would be to set up with gloves on obviously you can tell by the photo that doesnât work for some reason the bungee cord was not pulling the polls in to the hub I had to pull the extra cord out with my fingers in order to assemble the tent The other weird thing is they added mesh to the rain fly over the vents which means you cannot open or close the vents from inside the tent you have to go outside I should note I set the tent up inside without the rain fly and the pole snapped together so I understand cold weather does affect things but it should not affect the bungee cords that badly I would think but then again I donât know
review.name: Definitely not worth the money
comment: Hi Benny, Thank you for taking the time to leave your review. I am sorry to hear about your concerns with your Mountain Pass 2. If you would like to give us a call at 1-800-572-8822, we would be happy to discuss this further.

name: Mountain Pass Tent: 2-Person 4-Season

review.reviewBody: Big hex! Only complaint is couldnât buy every size at once like the stopper pro set
review.name: Big boy

review.reviewBody: I wanted a big Hex and that is exactly what this is. Good construction and materials. Feels like it will last for years to come.
review.name: The Big One

review.reviewBody: Hexâs are a must in my opinion for trad climbing. They offer the versatility of a nut and a cam and are great to drop into cracks. The wired option allows for a longer life span than nylon. Ounces make pounds but no need to have them reslung in ten years.
review.name: Must Haves

review.reviewBody: Iâm a big fan of the BD hexes. I donât use them too often, but when they fit they always inspire confidence. I like that they have a cable rather than a sling, however, the cable thickness could be adjusted in my opinion. If the cable were a little thicker/ stiffer it would be easier to place and clean them in my opinion.
review.name: Wired hexentrics

I've had different Patagonia tops in the past like this but they've disappeared from my wardrobe, so now it's back :)
review.name: Just perfect weight

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Long-Sleeve Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: Really comfortable and light weight, perfect for when you want to be outside and get some coverage from the sun

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Long-Sleeve Shirt - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Falcon Evo GV Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I got these a few weeks ago and love em!! I have done a few hikes with them as well as worn them around town and they are very comfy for both!!! No break in time needed!! They are true to size, I wear a 9 and ordered a 9â¦great fit!
review.name: So far so good

review.itemreviewed: Falcon Evo GV Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was so excited for these but I guess they aren't going to fit unless I exchange and size up.  The heel and mid-foot fit fine but with my usual wool hiking sock the toe box is a crunch at my usual size.  Also I am not sure I like the way the heavy heel area feels higher than the toe but that is probably because I'm used to no-drop trail runners.  The overall construction appears sturdy and I will order other boots with a Vibram sole.
review.name: Small toe box

review.itemreviewed: Falcon Evo GV Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
So far I have 90miles on them. I did a section hike of the PCT here in Washington over 6 days. The boots were a great happy medium between the trail runners I ofter see on backpackers and full boots. I prefer more than simple shoes backpacking, especially off trail. But full leather boots get heavy. These offered good support on trail, gortex was nice and traction good. All while weighing only a few ounces more than a pair of trail runners. 

Only issue I had was on long downhill sections the laces would tighten at the toe end and pinch my foot. I took the laces out of the last set of loops at the toe and problem solved. Still felt like I could get locked in if I wanted to. 

No signs of wear on the lace loops either.
review.name: So far so good.

name: Falcon Evo GV Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I have been wearing these for three months and actually bought a second pair just in case you phase this style out, which it seems like you are going to. We got a bad downpour the other day and my feet got wet. Iâm very disappointed.
I wish I could Get the Moab Gore-tex Low boot in an Eight wide. It looks like you are phasing out the Gore-Tex and the waterproof low boot in this model. Not a very good business decision, I donât think.I am going to have to search a different brand now to get a real waterproof/Gore-Tex low boot.
review.name: Not really waterproof in the rain

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable with good support. Size 8 medium width.
review.name: True to size
comment: Thank you for the great feedback!

review.reviewBody: These shoes are relatively light weight but still rugged enough for rocky terrain.  The waterproof is good for rain and low water crossing.  Your feet will get wet if you submerged the shoe.  The material in the uppers is breathable and dried quickly.  This is my second pair of these shoes.  The first pair is still going, I just like to alternate my shoes.   I have been hiking for a year several time a week in Boquete Panama.
review.name: My go to hiking shoe.

review.reviewBody: I live in Seattle so waterproof boots are a must for my daily walks. I am on my second pair!
review.name: Wet climate

review.reviewBody: Comfy right out of the box, just like my last pair of Merrells that finally gave up the ghost after 10 years.    Purchased for a European trip where I knew I'd be doing a ton of walking.   These were perfect.   My 55 year old feet and legs never ached or got tired and we walked many miles per day.  Waterproof, so I was fine walking through drizzly Parisian cobblestone streets.   They would be great for heavy duty hiking too.   For lighter duty walking, such as on a path, I would probably pick something slightly lighter weight.
review.name: Comfort and performance

review.reviewBody: These fit comfortably right out of the box.  I did not have time to break them in as I bought them right before a trip.  Had a wonderful time hiking in the El Yunque rainforest in Puerto Rico. And they are cute!
review.name: Perfection!
comment: Thank you for your awesome feedback!

review.reviewBody: My feet started hurting as soon as I put them on. The arch was not in the right spot for my my feet. They are extremely rigid.
review.name: Not a good fit for me

review.reviewBody: The Moab 3 waterproof hikers were a gift for my daughter-in-law who, with my son, owns a small hobby farm in Missouri where they manage gardens that include pumpkins and berries, started some fruit trees, and care for ten chickens.  This is the second pair I gifted to my daughter-in-law, the first of which (after much wear and tear from daily use) gave up the ghost this summer.  The hikers have also been used for hiking.  I'll get her another pair in 2-3 years when she wears these out.
review.name: Merrell Helps the Productive Produce

review.reviewBody: Love 'em! Super comfy for day hikes and very little break-in time
review.name: Very happy!

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes because they are warm, comfortably fitted on the first few days of wearing without needing to break them in. They are definitely waterproof as I've been wearing them whenever it pours or snows. They are a bit heavy for everyday wear, but once a week is good enough for me. I walk several miles a day to and from work by choice, so I prefer lighter weight shoes. These are Moab 3 are great.
review.name: Great Waterproof Shoes, get them

name: Moab 3 Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Women's

description: Buy the Big Agnes Salt Creek SL3 Tent: 3-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Salt Creek SL3 Tent: 3-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Big Agnes Salt Creek SL3 Tent: 3-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this tent for Big Agnes tent design reputation and the large awning type door. The awning is really where your head goes, so not useful as an entry point as I had thought. However I found it very useful to put gear in as well as pack up. The engineering design of the tent is excellent with the best uniform clearance between the tent body and fly I have ever had in a tent by far. This makes for a drier tent in the morning. Easy set up. I  just car camped for a week in Yellowstone and nice and dry every morning. It never rained hard, so waterproofing not truly tested. It does have an excellent pole design with high quality poles. It does pack up very small to fit in checked bag flying. Negatives: very cheap/ thin fly/ tent material. Got a small rip in fly already I had to repair. Iâve camped several hundred nights without ever tearing a tent before. Plastic tie out points, zippers, and clips feel cheap, like they wonât last very long. I like the design so much that Iâm going to keep it, but this could have been the perfect tent with better materials. I had a Walrus backpacking tent I bought in 1995 and lasted me almost 30 years. I do not expect that out of this tent.
review.name: Very good tent, could be great

review.reviewBody:
I've owned this tent for a year and a half, and used it probably 25-30 times in various conditions.  Overall I absolutely adore this tent.  I never write reviews, but this tent has brought me a lot of happiness.    

Pros:
-Setup is relatively quick and easy, though the pole design is not my favorite
-The third door is very practical, providing quick and easy access
-The inner hanging shelf is super useful for storage of stuff sacks, bags, and extra clothing
-Nice and spacious interior, fits two adults and two (medium sized) dogs
-Has performed well in rainy and cold conditions
-Lightweight enough for casual backpacking
-After a decent amount of use and abuse (including from two dogs) the tent still looks great

Cons:
-Like many others, my rain fly arrived stained.  An unfortunate blemish for an expensive purchase, but I shrugged and moved on
-The stakes that it comes with are cheap and don't match the overall quality of the tent
-The storage bag tears VERY easily.  Mine is still in use but has a large rip at the top
-The footprint has to be purchased separately, and is difficult to also fit in the overly tight bag
-The pole design is a little awkward, especially during breakdown and storage (like trying to wad up a compliant spider)

In my opinion the pros outweigh the cons with this tent.  It quickly became my go to for car camping or light backpacking.  It still pleases me every time I set it up!
review.name: High quality, versatile tent

review.reviewBody: The same happened to me as the other reviewer Carlos E.  Tent seems great, but I haven't used it yet because I attempted to exhanged for a tent that did not have a stain on the rainfly.  Backcountry was great with the return process but the second tent also had a stain on the fly.  I am going to attempt to get just the fly exhanged directly with Big Agnes.  Paying $400+ for a tent that is not "perfect" seems a bit crazy for me too
review.name: Rain fly also stained/blemished

review.reviewBody: It feels like we received a factory second to be honest. The tent is great, sets up easily and quickly, spacious, wonderful, and seems to meet all the other great reviews...however, the rain fly is considerably stained/blemished. This cosmetic issue will most likely not impact the performance of the tent, but definitely feels like a product one would find at the factory sale vs. from a retailer. Paying $400+ for a tent that is not "perfect" seems a bit crazy. We will keep it and use it, but a little disappointed on the quality control .
review.name: Factory second?

name: Salt Creek SL3 Tent: 3-Person 3-Season
Salt Creek SL3 Tent: 3-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody:
Coghlan?s Cast Iron Broilers are great for cooking all sorts of foods
from snacks to main courses to dessert. Made with pre-seasoned cast
iron for cooking over the heavy heat of campfires or barbecues. The
open slots on each side of these broilers let grease escape. These
Broilers are made for cooking burgers but are also great for cooking
chicken, steaks, veggies, and much more. Removable handles and
the open-hinged design make the Broilers easy to take apart and
reassemble for simple cleaning and convenient storage. The staycool
wooden handles and locking s-clips ensure that your cooking
experience is comfortable and hassle-free. Available in a single or
double size.
? Weight: 4.5 lbs. (2 kgs.)
? Complete length with handles: 26.3"
(67 cm
review.name: Put The Meat (or Meat Sub.) To The Heat!

review.reviewBody: The fit is great and sizing feels accurate. Low profile look, with great ventilation.
review.name: Accurate, low profile fit!

review.reviewBody: Had a really bad crash resulting in a broken collarbone and some broken ribs. Basically slammed my face into a berm but the helmet did it's job, saving my head and face from major damage. BackCountry also did a full Crash Replacement which was awesome!
review.name: Did its job, BackCountry replaced!

review.reviewBody: I purchased this helmet after having sweet protection whitewater helmets that I liked a lot. This helmet has not been great. in fact it is probably the worst helmet I have ever used as far as quality. the design is fine. it fits like you would expect a full face helmet to fit. I purchased directly through the sweet protection website, which took nearly a month to ship. after 4 rides in about a month the entire harness of the helmet was coming apart at the plastic joints and at the adhesive bonds. Sweet replaced the helmet for me. The shipping took another month, and after 3 rides the replacement helmet fell apart in the same ways. At this point, Sweet is refusing to refund my purchase. I would not recommend this helmet to anyone, and If you decide to role the dice I would definitely not recommend purchasing from Sweet Protection directly.
review.name: Disappointing quality

name: Arbitrator Mips Helmet

description: Buy the Thule Basin Wedge Tent online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Basin Wedge Tent
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Basin Wedge Tent online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I ordered the Basin Wedge because I wanted a convenient and simple RTT that is quality built and comfy. The Basin Wedge does not disappoint and is more impressive in person. I could have gotten a cheaper tent, but didnt want to compromise on build quality.  Also, my MPG didnt take too much of a hit (down 1 MPG in city). I'm very happy with my purchase!
review.name: Impressive build.

review.reviewBody: Amazing setup, super easy and fast install and the tent deploys in seconds. The mattress is VERY FIRM, otherwise it's amazing.
review.name: Amazing but a FIRM mattress

review.reviewBody: Plastic cracks for no apparent reason...Thule may or may not be helpful, may or may not blame you!
review.name: Watch Out
comment:
Thank you for making us aware of the damage to your Thule Basin Wedge rooftop tent. A representative has reached out for more information and see what options are available. 
Thule products are covered under a limited lifetime warranty for material and manufacturing defects. If you feel the damage is the result of a fault in the product, you can fill out a warranty claim form at the link below:
https://www.thule.com/en-us/about-thule/warranty

review.reviewBody: I've been using the Basin Wedge for every camping trip this Fall and I have no complaints. Both the set up and the installation were super quick (will need 2-3 people to lift and guide onto the racks though- it's heavy and an awkward shape for lifting). The most surprising thing for me is how well I sleep in it. The mattress is comfortable and it does a great job of blocking sunlight for mid-day naps. Highly recommend.
review.name: Breezy Set Up, Comfortable

name: Basin Wedge Tent

review.reviewBody: these poles are soo amazing! i've had the trail trekking poles for years and decided to upgrade. i haven't gotten to hike with them yet but so far loving how easy they are to adjust and the built in tool for adjusting. the color is beautiful.
review.name: Love them so far

review.reviewBody: The trekking poles work well, are lightweight, and are easy to adjust! Have held up well to hiking so far, and the built-in hex key (in the lowest segment of the right pole) is a great feature for adjusting the tension in the locks.
review.name: Good, lightweight poles

review.reviewBody: Just purchased and used these poles in the backcountry of Trinity Alps Wilderness. Held up well in multiple ascents/descents. Love the cork grips!
review.name: Backcountry experience

review.reviewBody: Been using them for a month now, no complaints. As advertised.
review.name: So far, so good

review.reviewBody:
After a lot of research I bought the pursuit poles and am very happy with it. Used it for my recent hike to Mt. Rainier. 
Wish they came with the protective cover for the tips.
review.name: Great supporting ones

review.reviewBody: This is my first set of trekking poles but everything seems well built and sturdy. Clamping mechanism locks tight.
review.name: Very Well Made Trekking Poles

review.reviewBody: Great combination of weight, sturdiness, and collapsibility. 10/10 would buy again!
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: Used this pair of trekking poles three times since purchase. Reliable as always. Built in screwdriver is handy. Comfortable wrist strap and cork handle. I will continue to support Black Diamond.
review.name: Very reliable trekking pole

review.reviewBody: I was surprised when I slipped going uphill and I used the pole to keep from falling completely down but to my surprise the lower section completely bent. Only the second time using, I expected more strength in the material than that
review.name: Pole bent

review.reviewBody: First 100 miles and no issues so far. Rocky descents, mud, water crossings, and they haven't slipped or fouled.  The redesign on the Flick Lock is subtle , but makes a huge improvement on adjusting the poles quickly and not wearing down your fingertips.
review.name: Solid

name: Pursuit Trekking Poles

review.reviewBody: Low quality overpriced products. They failed to include all items in my shipment and never corrected the issue. Poor customer service and low quality products. Stick with Patagonia or similar brands instead.
review.name: Garbage - low quality and didn't deliver

review.reviewBody:
I'm 6'2, 200 lbs and wear a Large in Patagonia. This jacket fits like an XL, it's baggy and long, and the sleeves are baggy and comically long, like 3-4 inches too long. I actually double checked the tags because it felt like they'd sent me the wrong size.

Outside the the sizing, this is probably a great midweight jacket with the quality you'd expect from Patagonia, and the blue color is ð¥
review.name: Odd sizing

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased this jacket to replace a warranty return on an Eddie Bauer down jacket. That was a great jacket but the zipper blew out after a year and a half or so. Great jacket but very happy they stood behind their warranty. I used the return amount to purchase this jacket to be used as an all around winter jacket and midwest downhill ski jacket. I can't speak to the longevity since I haven't had it that long, although the build quality with Patagonia is always amazing (this seems no different). I typically wear a Patagonia L in their jackets and ordered the same. Seems to fit perfect with a little more room than I'm used to with their products. I'm 6'2" and 190 pounds so relatively skinny. The zippers are all high quality and the outer fabric seems very tough. I have no doubt it will last and have never had an issue with Patagonia repairing anything that's broken. I still have other gear from them thats over 5 years old and going strong. The insulation seems sufficient with extra in the arms and less in the body. Temp can also be regulated through pit zips. My only request (and this is minor) is that they add another snap layer for the powder skirt. I'm pretty skinny with a size 34 waist and would love to be able to tighten up the skirt in heavier powder. Otherwise this jacket is perfect as is with great wind and rain protection as well.
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and excellent looking and calidad
review.name: Excelente, just buy it

review.reviewBody: Sooooooo comfy. I love them. Best product. Love the UGG items. Thank you
review.name: Slippers

review.reviewBody: I love almost everything about Ugg's products. Their looks, comfort, and style.
review.name: I love the products I bought.

review.reviewBody: Great product my granddaughter loved them. Wanted the classic slipper but was very pleased with these!!
review.name: Happy with this product!!

review.reviewBody: I bought for my daughter for her birthday and she absolutely loves them.
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: I work from home and these slippers are part of my daily uniform. I bought my first pair 10 years ago and they held up great. I just purchased my second pair! I was inspired to buy this style originally because I was dealing with plantar fasciitis. They have great support and make me at least an inch taller. I have recommended them to everyone I know.
review.name: My second pair!

review.reviewBody: I wish the bottoms were a little thicker but they're still a great slipper.
review.name: Great slipper, bottoms could be thicker.

review.reviewBody: I'm a size 8 in women and when I bought there I bought a size 9 but they're still to small so I recommend going a while 2 sizes bigger. Now I have to go out of my way to rxchange them .
review.name: Size up 2 sizes

review.reviewBody: I really loved the light, creamy beige color of the goat as pictured in the photo . But after buying two pairs, they both arrived in what I would call a light gray color, nothing like the photo.
review.name: Goat color nothing like photo

review.reviewBody: I spent many hours trying to decide and research a mule styled slipper, from a semi ethical/sustainable brand (which UGG does fall into mid tier rating via "Good On You"). After reviewing so many companies, i decided to go with UGG because of their well know quality products and i felt like at least trustworthy about the quality since so many people rep them, where I didn't have the same confidence in other brands. I have not previously been an UGG stan. Well, they arrived and i was not impressed. I am a 7-7 and a half shoe and purchased a size 8 slipper. This is my normal size for any sneaker, slide, etc. The fur lining was soft, but so fluffy that it felt really uncomfortable and I had to force my foot in. It felt way too narrow and cramped. There is a possibility that they may have loosened up with wear but I wasn't willing to try that out and waste my money on something that didn't immediately fit. The upper was very nice, the brown color was rich, but I would say the actual foot base wasn't that comfortable, felt thin, and not worth the $ price. I think you are largely paying to be in the "UGG in group" and to rep the label.
review.name: Not impressed + too narrow

name: Scuffette II Slipper - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I am currently wearing 30 in waist pants, been losing some weight. My old soft shell pants fit over this nicely.  I have taken a fall or two, and they are definitely padded in all the right places!

I wore it a couple of hours in warm fall weather, and they seem to breathe well (torso was drenched in sweat).  They are comfortable, don't pinch anywhere etc.  The silicone cuffs keep them from slipping.  

With regard to size, they do seem slightly baggy. I tend to find most pants to be too tight in the thighs though, so I think the fit is great (better than too tight and strangling your sensitive parts lol)
review.name: Very thoughtful design

review.reviewBody: I'm 6'2" 175. Should have heeded the reviews saying that the sizing is way off.  Size medium was baggy around thighs and hips and a diaper in the chamois. Size down at least one size.
review.name: runs big

review.reviewBody: Decent liners, especially for the price. Chamois is thick and actually pretty good, I wasn't expecting much but I was surprised at how comfortable these were after a few hours.  Armor padding is in all the right places and doesn't inhibit movement at all especially once it warms up. Fit is a bit loose at first, can pull them up a little higher once the chamois is broken in to tighten up around the boys.  I followed the sizing chart and they fit me pretty well, they stay in place and don't move around.  If you have skinny thighs the legs may be a bit loose, which other reviewers had mentioned.  Fit well under mountain bike shorts. They do include loops which can be used to clip into shorts or to hang for drying. Overall I'm very happy with these!
review.name: Does the job.

review.reviewBody: The pad coverage of these is great but the fit is terrible. These are massive! They are crazy long and on my the chamois pad is way too bulky. I am 6'4" waist 34 and I sized down to a medium and even its a bit too loose and big.
review.name: Great coverage but horrible fit

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'8" 160# with a 32" waist -- the mediums were HUGE. Too big on the waist and extremely "roomy"...up front 8\. The pad placement and coverage seemed excellent but I had to return them.
review.name: Great pad design but poor fit
comment: Had to return mine as well. They felt like I was wearing a diaper and were far too big in the crotch area which was also too low.

review.reviewBody: I have tried Gforms which don't stay up. These fit well and cover with better padding.
review.name: Great padding snug fit

review.reviewBody: I'm new to the sport and love having some extra protection--and these are great! Super comfortable and the pads are placed well. I've taken a couple spills in them and, although I got a pretty good bruise after one fall, I am sure that it would have been SO MUCH worse. Anyway, these are great! Sizing is great as well. I'm a 33 waist (6 foot, 190 pounds), and the medium fits like a glove.
review.name: Pretty great!

review.reviewBody:
I bought this for downhill runs at the bike park. The build quality and protection seem fine. But, the fit is odd. I am 5'9"/160lbs w 33" waist. The waist fits fine but the length is a bit long and the leg bands are loose, so not great fit for my body. I have to fold the waist band down one fold to make the length better. The pad for your seat is a little wide so it has a bit of diaper feel to it. Not nearly as bad as the Fox Titan but not as nice as a standard bike short.
I am keeping for the protection, but it could be better.
review.name: good protection, but!

review.reviewBody: This part converts FM140 mount to PM160.  Most modern forks use the Newer FM160 mounting standard, meaning that this is a +20 adapter, and some folks have said that the caliper will rub on a 180 rotor using this adapter.
review.name: WARNING: does not work with NEW FM160

review.reviewBody: I used this to convert a 140mm rotor with a 160.  Extremely simple, quick, installation
review.name: Easy replcement

review.reviewBody: Both my road and gravel bikes had 160mm front and 140mm rear rotors. Found them lacking stopping power. Decided to try an upgrade to 160mm in the rear and was floored on how much more confidence inspiring they were on steep descents. Bought the second adapter for my other bike immediately after the first test ride.
review.name: 160 Rear Adapter -So useful I bought two
